Mercy, the healing guardian angel of Overwatch
D.Va, former pro gamer turned streamer and mech pilot
Widowmaker, brainwashed elite sniper working for Talon
Additional Characters here
1.content: Who among the lucky ladies shall be subjected to weight gain.
1.title: Watchpoint: Start of the Interactive

choices: Assist Mei with the experiment
Tracer always wondered how it felt holding the Caduceus Staff
Join Zarya and Winston for lunch
Nothing. Tracer gets kidnapped by Talon
Take the day off and hang out with Emily
11.content:
Another wonderful day at Overwatch HQ. Not a cloud flew across the clear blue sky. The unseen wind blew across the sky and whisked through Tracer’s brown hair. Tracer swung her legs over the side of the runway that’s located on the top floor of the building. It’s not every day an Overwatch agent gets to sit down and take in the scenery. Yet, Tracer’s enjoyment could only last so long.

“Phooey. This is boring. Wonder what the others are up to,” sighed Tracer rising to her feet and dashing off into the interior of Overwatch HQ. The doors slide open sideways for Tracer to enter, however she abruptly bumps into something soft and firm. Two gasped as they fell onto their backs.

“Hey! Watch where you’re going!” a careful voice barked while picking up the scattered cartons. Tracer adjusted her orange visor and rubbed the back of her head, “My apologies, Mei.” The climatologist too adjusted her classes, “Oh, Tracer. Sorry for yelling. I’ve just been so busy working on this experiment that I haven’t had much sleep or food to eat. So, I uh-got a little crabby.”

“No worries,” Tracer hands Mei the remain cartons she was carrying, noticing that they are bone-chillingly cold, “Say. What are these cartons of ice cream for?”

“I don’t have much to say about them since it’s an early prototype. But I can tell you that’s it’s aid for someone entering hibernation. If you come by my lab, I’ll be more than happy to explain more and maybe let you try a little.” Mei waved Tracer off as she headed toward her lab.

“That’ll be something to consider.” Tracer turned on her heel and continued walking around the HQ until she found herself in the Technical Bay portion of the headquarters. Here things like Pharah’s Raptora armor and Reinhardt’s hammer were stored and repaired here. Somewhere amongst the room Tracer spotted brief flashing of bright light followed by sparks scattering around.

“Oh, I’ve about had it with this blasted thing!” Suddenly a staff flung across the room right into Tracer’s general direction. Using her quick reflexes, she caught it before she was struck, “Having a hard time, Torbjorn?” Torbjorn’s grumpy scowl on increased in intensity once he laid eyes on Tracer, “Feh. Like you care, Rookie.”

“You can stop saying that. As of last year, I’m only one rank below you.” Asserted Tracer. “Yeah. Vell in my eyes you’ll alvays be a rookie.” Torbjorn twiddled his long beard and tapped Tracer with his big robotic claw, “Hey, since we rank so closely why don’t you take a gander at Angela’s malfunctioning Caducaus Staff.”

“It’s not going to blow up on me, is it?” Tracer said suddenly reluctant for catching it. Torbjorn replied all too passively, “I hope so.”

Torbjorn’s sick sense of humor never gets old.

“Anyway. What’s wrong with it?” The short and stout engineer rolled his eyes, “Angela mentioned something about Fareeha getting a weird bloated sensation after prolonged use of the staff. The vay I look at it is she’s just using it as an excuse to spend some “quality time” with her. Pheh. Love birds.” Torbjorn shook his head giggling and left.

“Perhaps, I could use the opportunity to upstage him. Show him that I’m not a rookie anymore. Then again, I’m not sure if I’m the type to be messing with Angela’s staff of all things.” Tracer thought, setting the staff down on the work bench and seeing herself out. Around the corner, Winston and Zarya laughed among themselves, “Salutations, Lena.”

“Oi. What are you two up to?”

“We’re about to grab lunch. Zarya here says she can eat as much as me. How’s that for a scientific impossibility.” Zarya snorted, “You’ll be needing to work on a new theory once I put you to shame. Eating as much as an average gorilla? Not difficult.”

“Eh-Scientist,” Winston chortled with his massive fangs flashing.

“Same difference.” Zarya smoothed her short pink hair, “If you would like to join us, we’ll be down in the mess hall.”

Tracer folded her hands behind her head and continued down into the lobby of Overwatch HQ. She’s surprised to see how relaxed everyone is today. Probably because there isn’t some big omnic crisis occurring or droves of protestors knocking at their doorstep, “Gee. There’s so much going on right now. What should I do with my day?”
11.title: The Calvary's here

choices: She intends on returning to Ecopoint: Antarctica.
She's doing this for an old friend she had recently contacted after 9 years.
Actually, there's a different reason for Mei's ice cream experiment...
111.content:
Weighing her options carefully on what was going to do for the day, Tracer eventually shrugged with both hands and said, "...Eh, why the hell not?" And with that, she decided to voluntarily assist Mei in her Ice Cream experiment. After all, most people don't know this besides her girlfriend Emily, but Tracer was known to have an adequately sized sweet tooth when she was a kid. Or rather, she was pretty fat as a kid, but she eventually lost the weight as she got older. Tracer couldn't help but lick her chops a little upon thinking of the ice cream Mei was experimenting with.

------

Meanwhile, within the spacious but archived confines of her personal laboratory, Mei-Ling Zhou was currently preoccupied with recalibrating her Cryo Gun, working diligently on some new modifications for her primary weapon of choice, as her emoting flying drone companion, Snowball, was recharging it's batteries from the safety of a nearby charging station, with the blue drone's battery being merely 62% charged and slowly but steadily rising.

Needless to say, Mei certainly felt right at home in a laboratory at Overwatch HQ.

However, unbeknownst to her awareness, the mechanical doors that led into her lab automatically slid open, revealing the young spry adult Lena Oxton, better known more commonly as "Tracer". Tracer casually walked inside the laboratory, her arms leisurely placed behind her head, as she then noticed a preoccupied Mei. Being quite the talkative Brit that she was, Tracer faced Mei and exclaimed, "Oy, Mei!"

Mei's reaction was nothing short of being caught by surprise, as she swiftly jumped slightly, accidentally knocking over several nozzle modifications for her Cryo Gun in the process, as they scattered across the pristine tile floor with a clatter. "Tracer, you scared me!" Mei said, as she managed to easily calm herself down some, just as Tracer soon apologized, "Oops! Sorry, love! Didn't mean to give ya a jolt."

"...So, uh... That ice cream you've mentioned earlier, Mei. What are you really doing? Ya know, besides hibernation." Tracer asked, diverting onto a different topic, as well as being curious about what Mei was doing with cartons of ice cream, while she assisted Mei in retrieving the scattered Cryo Gun nozzles. Shortly after the duo managed to place the nozzles back on the table, Mei turned around to look at Tracer and said, "Hâo ba (Alright then), Tracer. What do you want to know?"

Not usually the type of person to ponder about the bigger questions in life, Tracer wasn't exactly the sharpest tool in the shed when it came to super highly-advanced science. After all, she was more accustomed as a pilot, not a rocket scientist! So, in an attempt to come up with a reasonable question, Tracer cleared her throat a little and asked, "...Well, why are you making this super-enhanced ice cream anyway, Mei? Knowing you, you're more into freezing things than anything else."

Although she was mildly offended by Tracer thinking she likes freezing things too much, Mei decided to ignore that last sentence and focused on what Lena asked her. After all, the agile Brit did raise a valid point as to why Mei-Ling Zhou, a well-known climatologist within the scientific community, would divert her research towards ice cream. So, in response to Tracer's question, Mei spoke toward her and explained that....
111.title: Mei's Experiment

choices: A few days later, Mei & Tracer had finally arrived at Ecopoint Antarctica.
A day before they took off for Antarctica, Tracer was packing up a few things.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1111.content:
"*sigh*...I intend on returning to Ecopoint Antarctica, Tracer. I must finish what my, um..."late" comrades and I were researching involving severe weather anomalies." Mei bluntly explained, showing a hint of sadness amongst her positive demeanor. Of course, Tracer instantly realized what Mei's intentions were: The Chinese climatologist planned on returning to Ecopoint Antarctica, the very research center where Mei became the only surviving member of her research team after being in cryostasis for approximately 9 years.

After all, Winston told her what had transpired at Ecopoint Antarctica when Mei reunited with Overwatch, including the names of the 5 deceased members of Mei's research team. Adams. MacReady. Opara. Torres. And Arrhenius. A massive snowstorm hit the Ecopoint, and they lost connection to outside world. And when their food and energy supplies dwindled, Mei and her fellow scientist were left with no choice but to freeze themselves in cryostasis until help had arrived. Unfortunately, almost an entire decade had passed, and the only survivor of the cryostasis was Mei-Ling Zhou.

"Wait, what?! But...but why? Why would you want to go back to the very place where your bloody mates died?" Tracer asked, confused as to why would Mei ever want to return to the very same research facility where her fellow scientists and friends died, as she witnessed pack a few things in an industrial-sized duffle bag, where Mei then spoke toward the British woman with a calm but stern tone in her voice and answered, "...It is a manner of paying my respects to the friends I've lost, as well as to make sure our efforts to avert an extremely dangerous shift in the climate were not in vain. Adams, MacReady, Opara, Torres, and Arrhenius..."

But then, as she gave a long paused look at the USB drive in her hand, which held all of the accumulated research data gathered at Ecopoint Antarctica, then closed her fingers around the USB drive, exhaling a deep sigh and said, "...I need to finish what they started. What WE started." Upon hearing Mei's determination to complete the research she and her fellow scientists had started, Tracer couldn't help but feel a tinge of guilt, especially since there was a high possibility that Mei was going to do this alone, which didn't exactly sit right with the spunky Brit.

"Wait, Mei!" Tracer exclaimed, as she quickly grabbed Mei from behind her shoulder, which prompted Mei to look back at Tracer, just as the British brunette then spoke toward the Chinese climatologist and bluntly retorted, "...I'm goin' with you." In response, Mei couldn't help but express a look of surprise, her brown eyes wide open with shock, since she honestly wasn't expecting Tracer to say something such as this. At first, Mei wanted to ask Tracer if she was absolutely certain about accompanying her to Ecopoint Antarctica, but instead, she displayed a grateful smile towards the British woman and said, "...Thank you, Tracer."

"Yeah, um... No prob', love. Just, uh... Let me call Emily and let her know what's goin' on." Tracer replied, which Mei nodded in agreement. After all, she was well aware of how close Tracer and her girlfriend Emily were.
1111.title: Returning To Ecopoint: Antarctica

choices: From there, Mei & Tracer proceeded to enter Ecopoint Antarctica's interior.
However, before she could join them, Tracer was getting a call from Emily.
Actually, something else happened instead...
11111.content:
--Ellsworth Land Region, Antarctica--
-October 5th, 2076-
-9:42 am, CST-

Antarctica. Known for being the coldest, driest, and windiest continent on planet Earth, Antarctica was a massive landmass known only for it's freezing temperatures, capable of reaching up to over -81 degrees Fahrenheit, as well as being the only place where only those who were prepared would survive in this wintry wonderland.

But to one Chinese climatologist and a certain female Brit wearing a Chronal Accelerator on her torso... This was their intended destination.

When Mei-Ling Zhou formally announced her plans to return to Ecopoint Antarctica to her fellow Overwatch members, their responses were...mixed, at best. Reinhardt and Zarya were slightly disheartened, since they were going to miss Mei's always positive and optimistic attitude. Pharah was taken aback, since she had barely gotten to know the somewhat plush Chinese climatologist a little more in their brief time together. Mercy showed concern towards Mei's mental health, with both her and Torbjorn agreeing that she has been through much trauma at Ecopoint Antarctica. However, the most understanding of Overwatch's members who were cautious but supportive with Mei's decision were Ana, Soldier 76, Winston, and even Genji.

After all, those who understood what Mei had endured, they knew that she needed to get some closure, both for the research she and her comrades were analyzing, as well as forgiving herself for said comrades' deaths.

However, what the entire group didn't see coming, was the fact that Tracer was going along with the Chinese climatologist to Ecopoint Antarctica. And yet, despite such shocking revelations, the members of Overwatch gave their support toward Mei and Tracer's "expedition". Unfortunately, due to Overwatch's overall operational status and the limited staff available, Mei weren't allowed to use Overwatch's dropship/mobile command center, the MV-261 Orca, to transport themselves to Ecopoint Antarctica. However, Torbjorn and Reinhardt were able to find, refurbish, and modify a slightly outdated cargo VTOL aircraft, the CTV-362 Albatross. Torbjorn heavily modified the aircraft's hull with heat-sustaining electromagnetic coils, so the VTOL aircraft wouldn't get all coated in frost while in flight, as well as 2 extra fuel cells for those long distance flights.

Eventually, after almost an entire day of flying, Tracer and Mei had finally arrived at their intended destination, Ecopoint: Antarctica. Looking at the research complex from the air, both women could easily see that Ecopoint Antarctica has definitely seen better days. Snow had covered up a decent amount of space throughout the facility, including coating half of the landing pad in a thick sheet of snow and frost. But as Tracer maneuvered the Albatross over to the snow-covered landing pad, the updraft from the aircraft's four jet engines forcibly pushed away most of the snow on the landing pad's tarmac.

"There ya go, Mei! We're finally 'ere." Tracer said, as she landed the Albatross upon the landing pad. From there, Mei looked back at the British woman and replied, "Tracer, I, um... I just wanted to say: Thank you. For accompanying me here. You didn't have to come with me if you didn't want to." "And yet, I did. You're family, Mei, and family stick together through thick and thin." Tracer replied, referencing the Overwatch team as a family, as Mei handed her a snowsuit to wear over her clothes, while she then spoke toward Mei and continued speaking as she said, "And besides... I joined Overwatch to make a difference in the world for the better, even if it means hangin' out with ya in bloody Antarctica for who knows how long. Oh, and please, call me Lena. Afta all, we goin' to be spendin' a lot of time together, might as well call each other by our real names, right?"

"*giggle* Of course...Lena." Mei replied, as she began to equip her snowsuit. Though, whilst she was donning her own snowsuit, Tracer then spoke toward Mei and asked, "So, about that ice cream you were workin' on... What exactly was it supposed to do, anyway?" "...Well, according to my research, the ice cream I've developed is supposed to behave similar to MREs, only much more tasty. If my calculations are correct, the ice cream should be about as filling as a single full-course meal. But then again, I, um... I've never tested this on humans before, so I am unsure what the effects will be." Mei explained, as she calmly zipped up the front of her snowsuit overcoat, flexing her gloved fingers in the process.

Of course, Tracer couldn't but get a bad feeling churning a little in her stomach upon hearing what Mei had said about the ice cream, but attempted to ignore that bad gut feeling, as she then spoke toward Mei and replied, "...Well, here's hopin' that you've got more than just vanilla ice cream in those cartons." "*chuckle* I figured you would say that, Lena." Mei answered, as she then approached her drone companion, Snowball, waking him up in the process with a sing-song tone as she said, "Snowball, we're here~" In response, the little drone opened it's blue digitized eyes, making bleeps and boops as it awoke from it's slumber.

From there, Snowball whirred to life, where he hovered upwards and floated towards a custom exosuit built specifically for Snowball in mind. Apparently, it was built by Torbjorn as an automated cargo loader, using parts from various different Omnics, including some decommissioned Bastion-model sentries. Once Snowball properly connected itself to the cargo loader,Mei pressed a nearby button on the wall, which caused the cargo bay door to open, as it lowered itself onto the landing pad, forming a ramp in the process.
11111.title: Arriving At Ecopoint: Antarctica

choices: Now that she was inside, Tracer decided to check up on Mei.
Now inside the facility, Tracer decided to explore Ecopoint Antarctica some.
Actually, Tracer decided to do something else instead...
111112.content:
But then, just as she was about to accompany Mei and Snowball into the Ecopoint Antarctica facility, Tracer suddenly heard her cell phone ringing, blaring out the ringtone she used when her girlfriend Emily would be calling her. So, in response, Tracer swiftly went for her pants pocket and grabbed out her phone. "Lena, is everything alright?" Mei asked, now aware of the persistent ringing of the Brit's cellular phone, just as Snowball used his loader arms to carry a few crates full of ionic batteries for Ecopoint Antarctica.

"Oh no, it's fine, love! Just Emily giving me a call to see if I'm alright. Don't worry, Mei. I'll catch up with ya and Snowball, just go on without me." Tracer answered, which Mei easily understood. After all, she had the privilege to meet Tracer's girlfriend Emily last Christmas, so of course the Chinese climatologist understood Emily's concern for Tracer. So in response, Mei nodded in understanding toward Tracer and replied, "I understand, Lena. After all, we're most definitely a long way from King's Row. You go ahead and talk to Emily, Snowball and I will be heading inside."

"Thank you, Mei!" Tracer exclaimed, waving at the Chinese climatologist and her adorable robotic companion as they entered the facility through one of the research complex's main entrances. From there, Tracer proceeded to answer her girlfriend's call, as she placed the cell phone against her left ear and said, "'Allo?" "*relieved sigh* Oh thank god! You had me worried, Lena. Why didn't you pick up sooner?" Emily asked, relieved to hear the sound of her girlfriend's voice over the phone. But as she rubbed the back of her head with a bulky gloved hand, Tracer spoke back toward Emily and answered, "*giggle* Sorry 'bout that, Emi. Mei and I just got 'ere when you called me."

"*semi-depressed sigh* ...You know, I'm really going to miss you, Lena. I mean, the apartment's going to become a bit more lonesome without you around to liven things up." Emily said, already missing her beloved Lena Oxton, especially since her girlfriend was now in the middle of Antarctica. However, knowing Tracer, she was the sort of person who would definitely brighten up someone's day, especially Emily's. So, in response to her girlfriend's lonely mood, Tracer spoke toward her with a tone of positive enthusiasm and a slight hint of romantic flirtation towards the redhead woman and replied, "Aww! I miss ya too, love! But don't worry, what I'm doin' now isn't as life-threatening as goin' up against someone like, say, Reaper or Doomfist. Remember when I fought against that bloody Widowmaker to stop her from killin' Mondatta? You were sooo worried 'bout me I swear you were gonna 'ave a heart attack."

"And with good reason, Lena! That Widowmaker woman almost killed you back in King's Row." Emily retorted, where she then calmed downed some by taking a few deep breaths. Of course, she didn't blame her beloved Lena for being so reckless in the first place. After all, Lena is simply just doing her job as an agent of Overwatch: To protect the innocent and to avert any crises, whether they be natural or man-made. And as her girlfriend and lover, she had every right to be concerned for her safety. After taking a moment or two to calm her nerves, Emily then continued to speak toward Tracer and said, "*sigh*...Look. Lena, I understand that your line of work will take you to many dangerous places, but... While you're there in Antarctica, far away from home, just... Promise me you'll stay safe out there. Okay?"

Although Tracer thought that Emily was a little too overprotective, Lena understood that her girlfriend had a very good reason to be worried for her, where the British brunette exhaled a sigh and answered, "*sigh*...Alright, Emily. I promise." "Thank you, Lena. That means a lot coming from you." Emily said, reassured that Tracer solemnly swore to keep herself safe while she was in Antarctica. From there, Tracer fired back with a positive yet flirtatious remark toward her redhead girlfriend as she quipped, "Anytime, love. And who knows? Maybe Mei and I will have you spend a week or two down 'ere durin' Christmas. Think about it: A snowy tundra in the background, you and me snuggling together on the couch, watching some Rom-Com Christmas movies. It'll be fun!"

Emily couldn't help but express a cheeky grin on her face upon hearing such a delicious prospect. After all, she was somewhat of a sucker for a Rom-Com movie or two, as she then spoke up and replied, "*chuckle* Yeah, definitely can't wait for that." From there, Tracer knew that Mei will probably need her help inside the research facility, so she then spoke toward her girlfriend and said, "...Well, it sounds like I better get goin', love. Mei might need me to help her with some.... "Science-y stuff"." "*sigh* I understand, Lena. Just be sure to call me once in a while to let me know that you're okay. Alright?" Emily retorted, just as Tracer then quipped, "You betcha, Emi! And besides, if all goes well, I might be able to call ya on Skype. Ciao!"

And with that, Tracer ended the call with her beloved Emily, as she placed her cell phone back in her snowsuit pants pocket, then proceeded to grab some of her luggage, and walked out of the Albatross, only to be greeted by the chilling antarctic weather. This caused her teeth to chatter instantaneously, as she quickly began to rub her gloved hands together while she walked towards the entrance to the Ecopoint Antarctica facility, speaking to herself as she muttered, "B-Bloody hell! H-H-How does M-Mei even c-cope with these t-t-temperatures?" Eventually, after struggling with the cold, Tracer finally made it inside Ecopoint Antarctica, as the large automated industrial doors slid and closed shut behind her.
111112.title: A Call From Home

choices: A week later, Tracer notices a few..."changes", to her body.
Two weeks later, Tracer gave Emily a call via Skype connection.
Actually, something else happens instead...
1111121.content:
Now that she was inside Ecopoint Antarctica, Tracer couldn't help but stare in amazement and awe at how vast and spacious the research facility was. Long, clean pristine hallways around every corner, a comfy and spacious Recreation Room, and much more. In all honesty, it was a little overwhelming for Tracer, considering how this place was so big that there was a chance she could get lost in it's labyrinth-esque layout.

Fortunately for her, she had someone who knew the research complex's every nook and cranny: Mei-Ling Zhou. So shortly after taking in everything the facility had to offer, Tracer figured that she might as well find Mei and see what's needed to be done first, as she shrugged some and said, "...Well, looks like I better find Mei, considerin' how huge this place is." From there, Tracer proceeded to walk down the hallway to her left, noticing the wet spots on the floor in the shape of boot prints.

Figuring that those wet boot prints might be Mei's, Tracer instinctively followed the trail of boot prints, hoping that it could lead her to Mei. However, as she made her way through the facility, the British brunette unzipped her snowsuit overcoat, giving her some much-needed air, since she was getting a little hot and sweaty now that she was inside a heat insulated research complex.

Eventually, after almost 20 minutes of walking through the facility, Tracer managed to reach the end of the boot print trail, which stopped at a closed automated door. "Hmm... Maybe Mei's in there." Tracer said to herself, as she then approached the door, knocked on the metallic door 3 times and said, " Mei? Are ya in there? It's me, Lena!" A moment or two of silence passed by, until Tracer heard Mei's voice, which sounded muffled due to the Chinese climatologist was on the other side of the door as she answered, "I'm in here, Lena. The door's open."

From there, Tracer witnessed the steel door automatically slide open by itself with a loud hissing noise, which revealed both Mei and Snowball as they carefully loaded most of the ice cream cartons into several industrial-sized refrigerated containers. However, it was there that Tracer noticed that Mei was no longer wearing her blue snowsuit and white overcoat. Instead, she was now wearing a stretchy pair of sky blue pajama pants, which easily showed off Mei's plush curves, along with wearing a pair of fuzzy Yeti slippers on her feet. On her upper body, Mei was wearing a blue tanktop underneath a white fleece sweater with an emblem of the 2066 Summer Olympics brandished on the sweater.

Once she was finished storing the enormous supply of ice cream cartons, Mei then turned around to face Tracer and said, "Lena, why don't you take off your snowsuit? You're looking a little...winded." Obviously agreeing with the pajama-wearing climatologist, Tracer then stripped herself of the snowsuit's insulated confines, breathing a sigh of relief in the process. However, instead of wearing the trademark Overwatch outfit she usually wears, Tracer was currently wearing a red and black, buttoned up plaid shirt, which had it's long sleeves rolled halfway up Tracer's arms. On her lower body, the British brunette was now wearing a loose fitting pair of dark orange fleece sweatpants, along with a pair of cotton white socks on her feet.

"*pant* *pant* Sorry, luv. Its just that these were the only clothes I could find at the time that were "climate-appropriate"." Tracer answered, doing an air quotation gesture with her hands when she said "climate-appropriate". After all, it was Mei who highly recommended that the British brunette bring some clothes that were suited towards colder climates. But unfortunately, due to Tracer's... "Unique" condition, as well as her work at Overwatch, she never exactly went out to do much shopping for wintertime clothes, so she had to make due with what she found.

"...Well, I guess that makes sense, considering that we were mostly preoccupied with preparing for this trip. But anyway..." Mei replied, as she then pulled out two of the cartons filled with her experimental ice cream, placing it on the table in front of Tracer and continued speaking as she said, "...I've figured that since we haven't eaten anything in a while, we might as well try some of my experimental ice cream."

But before she could even utter a single word, Tracer's flat stomach began to growl profusely, causing her to blush a little in the process. After all, she hasn't eaten anything since they took off to Antarctica, so of course she would be starving for something edible. So, in response to her stomach's explicit betrayal, Tracer took one of the two ice cream cartons, pried open the lid to make sure that it was her preferred ice cream flavor (which happened to be chocolate), then looked back at Mei, who held out an ice cream scooper in her hand towards Tracer. "I figured you might want this." Mei retorted, where Tracer the grabbed the ice cream scooper out of Mei's hand.

From there, Tracer used the scooper to dig up a good enough scoop of Mei's experimental ice cream, then plopped the ice cream into her famished mouth. At first, she tasted nothing, but once the ice cream touched her tongue's taste buds, Tracer felt this sudden explosion of chocolate-y sweetness in her mouth. In her mind (as well as the blissful expression on her face), she almost felt like a kid in the candy store. But as the ice cream melted in her mouth, Tracer began to eat more of the experimental ice cream, whilst Mei used her tablet to monitor the microscopic Nanobots inside the ice cream, as a small collective of them now squirmed around inside Tracer's body, monitoring every minute detail, from her vitals, to her blood pressure, to even her metabolic rate.

After all, Tracer WAS consuming some experimental ice cream, so of course there had to be some form of scientific protocol and watchful oversight in such matters, especially if they have the words "EXPERIMENTAL" written all over it. And besides, Tracer was no stranger to having experiments performed on her, since she was originally the pilot who was supposed to fly the experimental Slipstream Jet fighter that Overwatch created.
1111121.title: Checking On Mei

choices: "...I'm into chubbier women, Lena."
"...I'm actually into fatter women, Lena."
Actually, Emily's response was entirely different...
11111212.content:
A wise man once said these words: "Time flies by when you're busy." And those words of wisdom couldn't be farther from that truth, especially for the likes of Overwatch members Mei-Ling Zhou and Lena Oxton. For the first few days they've spent at Ecopoint Antarctica, both Mei and Tracer mostly prioritized on repairing some of the more damaged parts of the research facility, including replacing the broken windows at the Main Observatory with a brand new set of durable plexiglass windows, along with getting rid of any residue snow that laid there in the exposed parts of the complex.

But when they were not busy fixing up and renovating parts of Ecopoint Antarctica, Mei and Tracer would usually spend some of their free time on numerous forms of entertainment, ranging from playing online co-op games on Mei's brand new PlayStation 10 video game console, to watching a few classic movies from the early 21st century on Demand, to even binge-watching some of their favorite television shows on both Netflix and YouTube Red.

However, over the course of two slow weeks, there was a slow but noticeably drastic change to both Mei-Ling Zhou and Lena Oxton. Or rather, to be more specific: A drastic change to their waistlines. At first, the first couple of pounds weren't too noticeable. But when Tracer went onto a scale to check her weight halfway through the second week, the British brunette was shocked to see that her weight had skyrocketed from 143 pounds (Her original weight, since she had a good amount of muscle on her fame), to almost a whopping 200 pounds!

Originally, Tracer had this lithe but somewhat voluptuous hourglass physique, which was the ideal body type that could make any man's head turn her way. But now, after almost 2 weeks of eating almost nothing but Mei's experimental ice cream, Tracer's body ballooned outwards from being thin but curvaceous, to becoming downright chubby, where it was slowly creeping it's way into Fat territory. In appearance, Tracer now sported a plump and small but noticeable paunch of a belly, along with subtle but clear signs of a muffin-top perched just above her waistline, both of which always made themselves noticeable underneath the British brunette's soon to be snug clothes. However, while Tracer's belly and muffin-top were noticeable, it was actually her lower half that stuck out like a sore thumb. As Mei sat on the bed in her voluminous white blouse and slacks, her belly hanging nearly to the floor as she watched Zarya finish putting her formal military uniform on, she couldn't help but compare her relationship to the long term one Lena had with her girlfriend Emily. Mei and Zarya weren't quite as sensual with each other as the two brits were, mostly limiting their PDA's to kissing and snuggling to share warmth but she still felt the two were incredibly close. When they held hands and talked about the things that they loved, Mei could feel herself falling in love with the athletic Russian superstar, and when they locked eyes Mei thought, and hoped, that Zarya felt the same way about her.

"Ah, I need to visit the tailor!" Zarya laughed. Mei looked over to see Zarya flattening out the front of the uniform and noticed a prominent bulge around the waist and the hips that looked far different from the muscle that was usually bulging through her clothes.

"Oh dear," Mei said, realizing what the culprit must have been. "I'm sorry..."

"For what, me putting on weight?" Zarya smiled, going over to Mei and sitting on the small end of the bed that Mei didn't fill up. "You said that your ice cream would keep us healthy, da?"

"Yes?"

"Then do not worry about it," Zarya said, smiling proudly. "It is long vacation, I might as well enjoy myself, and if that means getting a little bigger, Что есть, то есть."

"Don't you need to be...mobile, I mean?" Mei said cautiously. "For your work in Russia?"

"I can diet and exercise any time," Zarya said dismissively. "I would rather spend my time here with you." Mei turned red as a tomato as her emotions went into overdrive at that statement of affection and immediately leaned forward to try and kiss her, struggled to move close enough through her fat. Zarya gave a warm smile and leaned forward to meet her halfway.

---

"Crikey, what a spread!"

As the women converged on the table set up for Thanksgiving dinner (by a handful of helper robots, thank you very much Snowball and friends!), they realized it was indeed quite a spread. All the usual trappings were there, the turkey, stuffing, sweet potatoes and cranberry sauce, with a few Russian and Chinese delicacies sprinkled into the mix, but the real head turner was the size. All the food here could feed a dozen people on a good day, and only four people were going to partake in this feast. It's no wonder that Tracer and Mei had ballooned to the size of hippos if they considered this a meal.

Like the calm before the storm, Mei and Tracer lumbered over to their seats, forgoing chairs in favor of sturdy metal benches that would adequately support their weight as the gorging began in earnest, while Emily and Zarya took seats next to their girlfriends.

"I'm so glad you two could come," Mei announced as a preamble to what was to follow. "It's been a wonderful week having you here."

"Happy to be here," Zarya said with a smile.

"Glad we could come over," Emily said gratefully. "I'm sure Christmas will be fun too."

"Ooh I hope so!" Mei said brightly.

"Well, what are we waiting for, loves?" Tracer said, picking up her knife and fork with a look of intense delight on her face. "Let's eat!"

And just like that they were off, and while Zarya and Emily started out a bit more modestly, the speed at which their girlfriends began their feasting revealed just how shameless they were about how big they got. Rather then scooping it out onto a plate, Tracer had tipped an entire container of stuffing and turkey onto her plate while Mei had cut out the middleman entirely and pulled over a pot of mashed potatoes to eat out of directly with the big ladle. Emily tried to focus on her own food as she was quite hungry, but she kept being torn from her own meal to watch the two big girls engage in increasingly wanton acts of gluttony, from her girlfriend sucking down a row of sausages to Mei taking a straight hit of gravy after biting off a massive chunk of Turkey.

"Heh, you call that eating?" Zarya said with a smirk, pushing her own plate aside and grabbing onto a whole bowl of sweet potatoes and beginning to stuff them into her face. "This is how you go all out!" The Russian's competitive nature had pushed her into gorging as blatantly as the two other girls were, leaving Emily alone as the sensible one, and her resolve to remain that way was deteriorating.

Emily stared at the delicious, delicate cooked turkey sitting within arms reach, just begging to be picked up and torn into like a wild animal. As the decision tempted her, the new pot belly she sported weighed heavily in her lap. Letting her mind wander, she pictured what would happen to her if she gave in like this. She pictured herself getting bigger, popping the buttons off her shirt as her belly surged into her lap. She imagined the feeling of splitting the backside of her pants as her thighs bloomed outward, the feeling of shattering chairs underneath her growing rear end. And at last she pictured the two of them together in a massively huge bed, her arms wrapped around as much of her beloved Lena as she could reach. She saw herself the same size as her girlfriend, overflowing with flab and rolls and multiple chins...

...and it looked so hot.

"Gimme that turkey!" Emily shouted.
1111121212113.title: Tipping the Scales

11111212121131.content:
As Thanksgiving came to a close and the Christmas season began in earnest, fans of the "Zhou & Oxton Let's Play" were treated to an early Christmas gift as their two favorite streamers returned to the online world with a gut-busting mukbang session that included two very special guests; the esteemed Russian hero Aleksandra Zaryanova herself and Emily *convenient alarm noise blocking out the audio*, prompting a spiffy rebranding to reflect the new roster after a successful first video; "Ecopoint Gang Let's Play". Some grumbled at this unwelcome change, fearing the chemistry between the two classic hosts would be overshadowed by this foreign superstar athlete and Tracer's adorkable main squeeze, but the worries quickly melted away as the fans got to know the two newcomers better. Zarya's presence even began to attract a sizeable foreign audience to the stream, meaning Overwatch and the Ecopoint mission were getting more donations then ever.

That wasn't the only change that followed, of course. Lena and Zarya's arrival meant that space needed to be made to make sure everyone had room, and the four of them decided that it was the perfect opportunity to overhaul their little living space deep in the antarctic wastes. Armed with an army of drones and robots, the four of them knocked down old walls and set up new ones in the spacious hanger/living area Mei and Tracer spent the better part of a month in, turning the whole place into a finely tuned complex, with areas like a new space for all the gaming and streaming stuff, a lab where Mei could perform research on her experimental ice cream, a crafting area where Emily could continue her work on fursuit commissions, and of course a large and incredibly well-stocked kitchen for the ever-increasing mukbang sessions.

That last section was notable of course because as the Christmas holiday went into full swing, more and more of the time spent by the four girls revolved around eating. Mukbangs became so frequent that fans started to complain about how there were more videos with them eating, so the four of them simply began eating copious amounts of food during the gameplay sessions, often integrating it into the challenges that were voted on by the fans. And all that eating, fueled by competition, love, and science to various members of the Ecopoint Gang, had a highly predictable effect, necessitating the installation of a brand new industrial scale, one that projected numbers on the wall and not on the scale itself.

Tracer looked at the scale with a trembling excitement as she ran her hands all over her body, crammed into an ill-fitting tanktop to cover her breasts and little else and the stretchiest pair of shorts she could find. All of this began as something Tracer did for her girlfriend, sure, but as she got fatter and fatter Tracer found she was really starting to enjoy the sensation of eating and getting bigger. She liked that her breasts swelled to be larger then her head, she liked how her belly collapsed in rolls down her crotch, but most of all she couldn't get enough of her ridiculous rear end, which had quadrupled in size and had started to stick out behind her like a shelf, paired with an egregious set of thunder thighs and hips that would brush the sides of double doors. Slapping each cheek with both hands and sending them on a jiggling rampage, Tracer finally stepped up onto the big scale, imagining her fat feet spreading across the cold metal surface as it groaned to support the massively obese speedster. There was a small ping as a number was projected on the wall, making Tracer's eyes light up with excitement.

"I did it!" she shouted, throwing big flabby arms busy overflowing her elbows into the air. "Fifty one stone!"

"Knew you had it in you, Lena," Emily said proudly, handing over a salad bowl full of ice cream for Tracer to gorge herself on. "You're getting bigger and hotter every day," she cooed, petting the side of her almighty rump.

"Hey, I'm not the only one, get on up and show me how big you're getting!" The massive speedster waddled to the side to let Emily through, who looked at the scale with as much excitement as Tracer did a moment ago. Since that fateful Thanksgiving Emily became hooked on the idea of getting fat and while she wasn't the size of her incredibly sexy girlfriend just yet, she was on her way. Emily's gain was a mirror image of her girlfriend's, oddly enough, with much of her weight concentrated in her upper body, especially her breasts. Those melon-sized sweater puppies entered rooms before she did now, and were growing so fast that Emily resorted to stretchy Christmas sweaters instead of bras to keep modest. She'd started wearing her hair back to show how thick and wide her face and neck were getting and her meaty arms wobbled with every tiny movement she made and filled her shirt sleeves like sausage casings. Slipping off her comfy shoes, Emily took a ponderous step onto the scale and waited, experimentally pushing against her belly to find out if she could see anything below her belt past that colossal mound. Tracer let a low whistle as the display popped up, and Emily's face heated up when she looked up at it.

"Twenty three stone, wow!" Tracer said admiringly. "You sure know how to pack it in!"

"Well I learned from the best and biggest fatass in the world, didn't I?" Emily said seductively.

"Not if you have anything to say about it," Tracer said, catching onto what she was up to. "You're so fat now, I bet you'll start getting caught in doors and breaking chairs." Boy if that didn't get Emily all hot and bothered, nothing would. Almost on instinct, Emily pushed herself up against her girlfriend's bulk and reached out to start kneading Tracer's mountain of chins. The speedster moaned softly as Emily ran her meaty fingers all across her face and thick neck, tipping backwards and falling on her butt with a ground-shaking thud, Emily falling on top of her waterbed of a belly with a giggle.
11111212121131.title: A Big Fat Christmas Season (Part 1)

111112121211311.content:
Nearby, Zarya felt the ground shake from Tracer falling over and gave a slight chuckle, hoisting the heavy barrel onto her thick shoulder and carrying it to the lab area with a ponderous gait. As a large woman herself (admittedly in a different way then she was now), Zarya had always been a proponent of a confident self-image and being happy with one's own appearance and body, and it pleased her to see that the two Brits were embracing that idea fully, and in more ways then one. And seeing how Zarya was getting big all over nowadays, it was a message that she embraced as well.

She still regularly lifted weights to maintain her incredible strength, but the muscles have long since been padded and covered up by layers of jiggling adipose, making her thick arms and legs even thicker and unable to fit into most shirts and pants, hence why Zarya was walking around nowadays in a tank top and shorts that were on the verge of splitting open at the thigh. There was no muscle in the jelly belly that hung out the front of her shirts and over her waistband nowadays or the ring of fat surrounding her wide face, but Zarya still had to admit there was something...alluring about the way her belly swayed back and forth at times. She loved the feeling of being big and powerful, and she was getting bigger and bigger every day. Who could complain about that? Mei certainly wasn't.

"Ooh, did another flavor finish up?" Mei asked as Zarya entered the lab.

"Yes, some sort of berry flavor," Zarya said, lumbering over to a large mechanical pump in the center of the lab and slotting the barrel into the empty frame. "I am glad your formula works on other foods. I was beginning to get slightly bored of the ice cream."

Milkshakes were the next logical step," Mei mused, typing away at her little workstation. Indeed it was, at least for the Chinese climatologist. The whole Ecopoint Gang may have been fattening up, but she was still the reigning queen as far as weight was concerned. Sitting sprawled across her massive metal bench, Mei-Ling Zhou had morphed from a belly heavy fatso to an absolute blob, bearing a massive blubbery gut that dominated her figure and nearly touched the ground even in the rare instances where she was standing up. Enormous breasts the size of pumpkins fell to either side of her great belly, and down the center descended a ring of neckflab as big around as a large pizza, stacked with quite a few chins that dropped from Mei's incredibly wide face. Her joints had long since vanished, swallowed up by her thunder thighs and bingo wings, and her butt rivaled her massive chest in size and would have counterbalanced her if not for the great big belly cascading down her front. There was absolutely nothing about her that was thin and lithe anymore; even her feet were much too fat to wear her shoes and she needed a new keyboard with bigger keys that her sausage fingers and padded palms could use effectively.

"Right, that's...working..." Mei said, sounding distant. "Might want to...try some...more..." Putting the nozzle back in her mouth, Mei released the lever again and just kept drinking it, getting lost in the incredible flavor and the pleasure of eating. Zarya, smiling, sat her big butt down next to her and picked up the second tube to start drinking down the milkshake with her.

Before they could gorge themselves again, one of Mei's consoles buzzed, shocking her out of her reverie. Her eyes widened with surprise at the notification, though she wasn't surprised enough to stop drinking.

"What's wrong?" Zarya asked. Mei took a great big gulp of milkshake and pointed at an alert indicating...

1111121212113111.content:
"An intruder!?" Zarya exclaimed in disbelief. "Where? How would they have even gotten here." There was a wet plop as Mei extracted the feeding tube from her mouth and tossed it over her thick shoulder before shifting her bulk and moving up to her screens.

"Let me pull up the camera feeds....hùnzhàng!" Mei swore under her breath as her chubby fingers selected three options at once. Slowing down to precisely select the options, the screens in front of her suddenly filled with shots from the security cameras outside the base, with one noticeable exception.

"What happened to this one?" Zarya asked, pointing out the one display that was made up of gray static.

"Camera five...that's on the other end of the base," Mei realized, glancing down at her enormous belly hanging over her knees like an apron made of bread dough. "Gonna be weeks before we can get over there..."

"I'll head over there and investigate!" the Russian war hero announced, triumphantly jumping to her feet so quickly it made her belly bounce and forced out a small little belch.

"Well okay, but be safe Alex," Zarya leaned over with some effort and gave her blob of a girlfriend a kiss on the cheek, both of which flushed red on contact.

"Do not worry, darling. I am still the strongest woman in the world, after all!" Turning on her heel, Mei watched her girlfriend wobble out of the room, her heart fluttering with every heavy wobble of her monstrous rear end.

"You certainly are," Mei swooned, pawing around her shoulder for the feeding tube.

"Here you go chica," someone behind her said, picking up the tube with her slender fingers and handing it to her.

"Thanks," the climatologist said thickly, suckling down on her berry milkshake again. It took a few seconds before her eyes shot open with surprise and she yanked the tube out again.

"Alex! ALEX!" Mei tried to shout before something prodded her in the nose.

"Boop!"

There was a flicker of purple light as the cloaking field dropped, revealing the neon-purple garbed hacker Sombra grinning wickedly in her face, her usual jacket replaced with a thicker woolen coat in the same color scheme with an oversized hood. Perfect winter wear, more or less. It took may a second to notice the light-footed hacker was perched on top of her belly like a cat.

"Hola gordita!" Sombra greeted her in a mockingly friendly tone. "I've been following you and your buddy's streams, can I get an autograph?"

"Get off me!" Mei demanded, wobbling back and forth helplessly.

"Wow, I guess it's true what they say, don't meet your heroes." Sombra held out one hand and pressed a few hexagonal buttons in midair, broadcasting the stock sound effect of an audience going "Awww!" as she pretended to wipe away a tear. Mei heaved back and forth, her stubby arms reaching outward to try and grab at the Talon agent, only for Sombra to lean backwards out of her reach, stifling a large phony yawn. Giving one last lurch, there was a sudden snap as the bench Mei overflowed couldn't take any more punishment and broke cleanly in two. Both of the girls toppled over, Mei landing in a great wobbling heap that refused to quit jiggling for some time and Sombra bouncing away, laughing like a hyena.

"Nice little setup here," Sombra said. "Almost as good as my setup. Makes things easier."

"What are you even doing here?" Mei demanded in between great heaving breaths and trying to get to her feet, an utterly impossible task at her size. "What does Talon want with our fundraising operation?"

"Please, if I wanted your charity funds I could have done it from home," Sombra said patronizingly as she started rooting through all of her files. "I just want your data."

"That and everything else," Sombra continued, finishing up her searching and using her hacker suite to put the finishing touches. Turning to face Mei, Sombra leaned against the console and inserted a purple USB drive into the slot on the mainframe and pressed one last button that flashed a large purple loading bar on the screen.

"Y-you're stealing all the data in the system!" Mei exclaimed in disbelief.

"I don't think you realize just how valuable all of this data is, not just your Overwatch files but everything you and your little climate research team was working on," Sombra went on. "I couldn't get to it when this place was abandoned, but now that everything's turned on again, feliz navidad to me!"

"You'd seriously risk breaking in here and stealing all our data with Overwatch agents running the place?" Mei said in disbelief.

"Well you did make it easier by gorging yourself senseless," Sombra said, prodding the edge of the belly flowing across the ground with her big toe. "I just had to wait til the Ecopoint Gang got too big to move and I could just walk out of here with your data, and I must say you played your part wonderfully."

"You're not gonna get away with this!" Mei said weakly, prompting another chuckle from the elite Talon hacker.

"If I had a peso for every time I heard that I wouldn't need to be stealing your data," Sombra said, watching her download finish up and unplugging the flash drive, putting it in her front pocket for safekeeping. "However, because I'm a nice girl..."

"What are you-Mmph!" Mei grumbled as Sombra leaned over to stick the tube back in her mouth.

"Enjoy your little desert, chica," Sombra said with a light wave. "Adios!" As she turned away, leaving Mei as little more then a helpless blob sucking down her milkshake, a large figure suddenly appeared, filling up the doorway.

"What's going on in here?" said...

"What's going on in here?" Emily said, huffing and puffing as she caught her breath. "Tracer and I heard the alarm...who the bloody hell are you?"

"Wait, I know you! You're that hacker, Zamboni!"

"It's....how do you even get that from...madre dios just move!"

"Seriously, chica, you think a whale like you has a chance against an expert Talon agent like me? Why don't you go back to your fursuits like the good little creep you a-"

*Wham!* *Pow!*

Sombra was too busy being amused at the situation to defend against a hard punch to the gut, followed by a slap that sent her spinning. Coming to a stop and holding her jaw tenderly, the hacker stared at her opponent in disbelief.

"I started taking self-defense courses when I began dating Tracer years ago, so she wouldn't have to worry about me being kidnapped or hurt by bad guys like you!" "Good job Snowball!" the blobby climatologist said, fist-bumping the robot's little claw with her other hand.

With a feral yell the hacker launched herself onto the massively obese climatologist and tried to rip it from her, her chaotic shriek drowning out Zarya's returning footsteps. Mei, utterly shocked, held onto the device with a death grip as Tracer and Emily tried to pull the hacker off her, but Sombra was driven by desperation and was too much for even them to handle, even the mighty Zarya who was hampered by her bulk versus Sombra's lithe form. Emily barely managed to pull Sombra's fingers out of Mei's many layers of flab before she was kicked squarely in the double chin and knocked back into Mei's milkshake device, one of the feeding tubes plopping down on her shoulder. Having a sudden epiphany, Emily smiled, desperately clinging onto a sudden idea that was too crazy not to work.

"GET...OFF....ME...YOU...AAArumf!"

"Put it on full blast!" Emily shouted. "HURRY!"

Tracer dashed for the controls but Zarya had a more expedient solution, ripping off the flow regulator with brute strength. The milkshake container, still half full despite Mei's feasting, drained like a sieve, flowing down the pipe into Sombra's mouth. She relaxed her grip to try and get the tube out, letting Emily and Tracer pull her off Mei and toss her against the wall. The four of them watched as Sombra fidgeted to try and remove the tube, but her resistance quickly faded as the flavor of Mei's new and improved formula hit her, making her go cross-eyed and slide to the floor. As the Ecopoint gang caught their breath, they watched as Sombra's belly inflated before their eyes, snapping off her belt and beginning to droop over her waist. As the tank gave an airy hiss upon emptying, Sombra's face slackened, letting the tube fall out and clatter to the floor. She opened her mouth, probably to swear at the group, but the only thing that came out was a monstrous, window-rattling belch, followed by a seam splitting and her brown watermelon of a belly popping out of her jacket into her lap.

"Blimey...nice job gang," Tracer huffed. "Anyone up for a snack before we call back home?"

111112121211311121.content:
"So...I see you've been busy," Angela Ziegler said coolly, eying the wobbling massively obese bodies of the Ecopoint gang.

"Haven't you been watching the streams, Mercy?" Tracer said in response, shoveling ice cream into her mouth with gusto just like the other girls.

"On and off. Things have been rather busy." Shivering slightly, Mercy drew her overcoat around herself a little tighter as she watched Soldier 76 personally lead away Sombra in handcuffs, flanked by a small squad of Overwatch foot soldiers. Her expression was a mixture of cool fury and nausea, not helped by that overstuffed gut of hers hanging down like a sack full of water from her waist.

"You can't....*brraaaaap*...hold me forever, Over-*bwuuuurp*-watch," Sombra insisted, her threatening tone undercut by her frequent belching. "I'm gonna...*uuurp*...get....that data....someday! *hrup*"

"Yeah yeah, get moving punk," Soldier 76 ordered, gruffly shoving her forward with the butt of his gun. The defeated hacker tottered slightly but kept on moving.

"I should have known better then you send you two up here on your own," Mercy said, wringing her hands with concern. "If Talon's agent had succeeded, or worse..."

"I think we handled things pretty well, all things considered," Mei pointed out. "Plus having Alex and Emily along was pretty good protection."

"Alex? Oh, right," Mercy said, noticing Zarya give her girlfriend's meaty hand a little squeeze. "I take it your research has been successful then, Mei-Ling?"

"Oh yes, very!" Mei said excitably. "I've finally been able to work out all the bugs in the formula and apply it areas outside their intended use."

"Besides using it as a handy disabling weapon in a pinch," Tracer giggled, thinking of Sombra again.

"And now that it's finished...I think it's time to put Antarctica to rest," Mei admitted.

"What!?!" the other three girls chorused.

"But we just finished setting things up, didn't we?" Emily pointed out.

"We did, but....well, I've been working with my old team's research for so long. All my research has been trying to rebuild and reclaim what we lost...and my old friends," Mei admitted, a tear rolling down her fat cheek. Mercy placed a comforting hand on Mei's shoulder as the group gathered (slowly) around her.

"I'll always miss my old friends and team...but I think I've been frozen in the past for too long Doctor," Mei continued, steeling herself. "It's time I looked to the future and start to push forward."

"That's very mature of you, Mei-Ling. I'm proud of you for coming this far," Mercy said, practically glowing with affection.

"I wouldn't have gotten this far without my friends," Mei admitted, her big cheeks turning pink from the vulnerable confession.

"And me," Zarya said, wrapping her arms around the expanse of Mei's girth and kissing her on the neck folds.

"Yes, and my wonderful girlfriend, the strongest woman in the world," Mei giggled, nuzzling into the kiss.

"Hey, don't forget us!" Tracer interrupted. Not even waiting for an answer, the two Brits quickly wrapped themselves around Mei's form, Tracer struggling to wrap around her upper body while Emily threw herself onto Mei's belly directly. Tears were streaming down the faces of all four of them, their affection for one another was so great. Even the stoic Mercy couldn't help but shed a couple tears at the sight of them.

*Crack!*

The moment was ruined somewhat when the reinforced chair Mei perched herself on gave way, unable to handle the tonnage of all four members of the ecopoint gang. Ice cream scoopers and cartons went everywhere as the girls fell over themselves, with Mei falling straight down with a tremendous boom and the other three bouncing away, their clothes bursting at the seams from the sharp drop. As a chorus of belches rose from the Ecopoint gang, Mercy picked up one of the discarded cartons, dipping a finger into it and sampling the stuff.

"Mmm, you were right, it is quite good," Mercy commented. "Now, about we address the elephant in the room. Or rather, the four elephants in the room...."
