11111213.content:
Sadly, Tracer and Mei barely had time to enjoy the overwhelming tastiness of the ice cream before the lights suddenly flickered, followed by the sound of a mechanical hum coming to a low, droning halt.

"That can't be good," Mei remarked, her face faltering as she suddenly worked furiously on her tablet. Tracer dashed out of the room at supersonic speed, returning a second later.

"Did a quick lookabout, something just conked out in the generator room, luv," Tracer explained. "Can't tell what but somethin' was smoking."

"What was?"

"Uh, big circular beast, smack dab in the center."

Mei's eyes widened with worry at this revelation. "That...that's the heating unit." Turning back to her notepad, she flicked through a couple pop-up menus before producing a hologram of the room Tracer just explored, the generator in the center of the room flashing emergency red.

"I take it that's not good news," Tracer pointed out as Mei frantically searched through more readouts and menus.

"No, that's bad. Very bad," Mei said. "The central heating unit is faulty."

"Well, don't we have backups?"

"We do, but-"

Mei was interrupted by another shudder from above, followed by another mechanical wind-down. A second of the holographic generators turned red and flashing, and Tracer suddenly felt a distinct chill in the air.

"-but when the main unit collapsed, it dumped everything onto the backups before they were ready. It'd be like if I dropped a heavy weight into your arms without you expecting it. The same thing is happening here, and its shorting out the heating units."

"Blimey...but it's below zero out there!" Tracer nearly shouted.

"About fifty five below, to be exact," Mei calculated as a third generator shuddered to a halt.

"W-we gotta hurry and get a flight out of here!" Tracer stammered, already beginning to see her breath on the air. She regretted with every inch of her being that her last meal would be a nice cold helping of chocolate ice cream.

"We won't be able to g-get on board and out of huh-here before we f-fur-reeze to d-death!" Mei said, her teeth chattering out of fear and the chill of the room. "W-we only have one o-option; sh-sh-shut the whole thing down, let Sn-snowball run the auto r-r-repair on the generators, g-g-get them up in f-f-few days, tuh-tops."

"G-g-great idea!" Tracer shot back sarcastically. "B-b-but what about us?"

"H-h-hurry, b-blink us to the backup c-cryochamber room!" the climatologist demanded, gripping onto Tracer's arm with an ice-cold hand.

"...C-cryochambers. Are you sure?" Tracer asked, well aware of Mei's particular history involving that particular piece of technology. How bad was the situation that Mei was the one recommending this option?

"Sn-snowball can let us o-out when it finishes!" Mei hurriedly explained. "GO!"

And Tracer went, her blink's slowed somewhat by the unfamiliar weight tugged along at her arm. Poor Mei clutched at her chest when they appeared in the room, gasping for air as she hurriedly punched in some numbers on the keypad in front of the cylinders. Two of them hissed and shot open, one on either end of the room.

"H-hurry!"

Tracer didn't need telling twice, leaping into her own tube as Mei leapt into hers. As the chamber sealed around her, leaving only the sound of Tracer's frantic breathing and pounding heartbeat, she suddenly felt rather lightheaded. There was a tingling sensation in her arms and legs as her heart rate slowed dramatically; she tried to say something, but her words came out slurred and incomprehensible. She felt her arms go limp at her side as her head flopped against the comfortable headrest, feeling too heavy to move. Her last thought before her eyes drifted close was how yummy that ice cream was...

---

Outside of their frozen chambers, Snowball immediately set to work, scrambling a small fleet of robots from the cargo jet as well as his exoskeleton to help fix the heating. The obedient little robot worked diligently, unfettered by the hours rolling by as he organized the repair teams and occasionally checked on Mei and Tracer in the cryonic chamber. The little robot zoomed through the hallways, his sensors never picking up the occasional trails of black smoke snaking their way through the halls. The robot turned a corner, and one smoke trail congregated as the skull-like mask of the Talon agent Reaper ascended from the ground like a specter. Seemingly unaffected by the cold, he snarled at where the robot was, his hand drifting to the shotguns beneath his cloak.

"It's a STEALTH mission, Reyes," Moira chirped in over the headset, predicting his thoughts to a T. "Don't cause any trouble."

"I wasn't going to," Reaper growled, drifting towards the cryochamber.

"Good. The date we're going to be stealing is invaluable to our efforts. I'd hate for you to explain to Doomfist how you lost it because of an icemaker. Now finish the mission."

Reaper groaned again, shrugging it off as he sunk into the ground, his smoke trail drifting under the doorway and re-materializing him on the other side, where a certain Mexican hacker was working the main controls, her slender form packed into a thick thermal suit and a devious smile curling her lips.

"Have you got the data yet?"

"Una momenta, Reyes," Sombra said, rolling her eyes. "I'm taking care of these two."

"We're not here to kill them," Reaper growled, indicating he didn't like that idea much.

"I'm not, I'm 'taking care of them'. Here, look at this." Sombra stepped aside, presenting the view-screen to her partner in crime. "There's a whole slew of biotech and medical equipment built into these things to help maintain the health of whoever is inside. It's a bit hard to crack open, but it's easy to trick the computer into thinking someone else is in the tubes."

"So?"

"So...look!"

Reaper did so, peering at the names indicated.

Pod 11: Lena Oxton Con: Stable
Pod 6: Mei-Ling Zhou Con: Stable

"Aaaaand...." Sombra announced, clicking a few times on the keypad. "Voila!"


Pod 11: Aleksandra Zaryanova Con: Dangerously Underweight, adm. Emergency Nutrition
Pod 6: Specimen 28: Winston Con: Dangerously Underweight, adm. Emergency Nutrition

"Cute," Reaper said, unimpressed. "Do you have the data?"

"Man, you're no fun Reyes," Sombra said, shaking her head as she looked upon her masterwork. "The doctor has everything we're looking for, we're good to go."

"Good."

Reaper landed an elbow strike on the back of Sombra's head, knocking her out cold instantly. She dropped like a sack of potatoes, tumbling down the stairs that descended to the cryopods.

"And that's our loose end tied up," Moira said with an air of finality. "I'm surprised you kept her on after she botched the Volskaya mission."

"The ingrate has her uses," Reaper grumbled. Punching in a couple numbers on the keyboard, he drifted over as the cryopod Sombra landed in front of opened up.

"What are you doing now?"

"I'd rather not leave a corpse," the Talon agent explained, hoisting the hacker over his shoulder before chucking her roughly into the pod.

"You're not worried that she'll give things away?"

"The brat's paranoid to a fault, and we've been feeding her false info for weeks," Reaper revealed out, sealing the pod behind him. "If Overwatch wants to deal with her, they're welcome to it. Now let's get out of here before those damn robots show up again."
11111213.title: An Emergency! Or is it?

choices: "We need to assess the damage and see how big we are!"
"We need to contact HQ!"
Before she says anything, the third cryopod opens. Uh oh!
111112131.content:
After what felt like a few minutes at most, a buzzing sounded in Tracer's ear. Mumbling slightly, she tried to reach for an imagined alarm clock before remembering where she was.

"Oh, right, the pods," she mumbled. "Ugh, I'm starved..." Relieved when the pod finally opened up, Tracer stepped out, a little unsteady on her feet, stretching out her back. Perhaps because she was coming back into a warm environment after nearly freezing to death a few days ago, but she seemed to feel a little slower then usual. Hard to say why, maybe she just needed to get active again.

"Hmm, Mei is still in her pod?" Tracer said to herself, pondering the unopened pod waiting to emerge. "I know, I'll prep some ice cream for her! Breakfast in bed sorta thing!" Thoroughly pleased with herself for this idea, Tracer zipped down the corridor, giving Snowball in his exosuit a high-five mid-dash, and ended up back in the kitchen right where the two had left off. Licking her lips at the thought of more of that ice cream, she opened the fridge to dig around a bit. As she decided which flavor to break out, she leaned against the side of the fridge, feeling a bit tuckered out from her dashing earlier.

"Whew, cryopod freezing ain't exactly a day at the spa," Tracer chuckled. "Bet it'd be a good way to work off a few-"

Tracer smacked at what she thought would be a solid set of abdominal, but felt her hand bounce off something else.

"-extra pounds?" Tracer looked down and nearly shouted in shock at something pink and fleshy hanging out the bottom of her shirt. It took her a split second to realize the mass was her stomach, looking like she swallowed a deflated basketball.

"What on...what?"

In disbelief, Tracer zipped down to the bathroom for a look in the mirror and almost doubled over in shock. A great big belly, pouring from her once slender frame was indeed there and very real. As she experimentally prodded it, Tracer became aware of other parts of her that were bigger as well. Her arms seemed to have more meat to them, and her chest seemed to be straining a shirt that was quite loose over her upper body before. Even her face looked thick and healthy, her once slender jawline melting into a round apple shape, complete with an extra chin if Tracer looked the right way.

"Blimey," Tracer exclaimed, turning around to see her butt in the mirror, which had swollen to chair-overflowing proportions. "I look like a mini-Roadhog!" Running her hands up and down her thighs experimentally, Tracer gave an involuntary shudder at the sensation, but quickly brushed it aside.

"Wonder if this is some sort of cryopod freezing side effect," Tracer pondered. "Maybe I can ask..."

A shriek sounded from down the hallway. Tracer clapped her hands to her mouth.

"Mei!"

Tracer quickly dashed back to the cryochamber, noticing how sluggish she was compared to her old self now that the truth was revealed. Scared for her life as to what may have happened, Tracer burst into the cryroroom...and smacked right into something big, fleshy, and soft.

"L-Lena!" Mei said thickly. "What...happened to me!?"

"Whaddaya.....BLIMEY!"

If Tracer was a mini-Roadhog, then Mei was clearly Roadhog proper. Tracer tested the limits of her comfy winter wear, but Mei had exploded out of hers, reducing her sweater to a bra and her pajama bottoms torn to ribbons by her new girth. And what a girth it was; a new buddha belly hung from her front, dropping downwards to knees that sunk into succulent layers of thigh and leg fat. Her arms were overinflated bingo wings that could barely reach all the way down her belly, and her voice was heavy and thick like pudding thanks to the ring of neck fat that added onto Mei's rather wide face and features. Said face was white with shock and confusion as she took heavy steps forward, her giant gut pitching with each step.

"S-something happened to the cryochambers!" Mei revealed. "We're both too big!"

"I should hope not," Tracer replied, failing to stop herself before she took a handful of Mei's adipose and jiggled it.

"LENA!"

"What? It looks squishy and fun to wiggle," Tracer said with a laugh in spite of herself.

"We have to...huff...focus!" Mei said, already losing her breath as she waddled around the small room she had begun to fill.
111112131.title: Resting a Little Too Well

choices: A hose leading to a vat of fattening substances. She's going to be tubefed!
A big slice of pizza with a lot more food waiting. Widow hand feeds Tracer!
A pill that will continuously expand Tracer!
114.content:
So far, everything presented for Tracer to do, felt incredibly underwhelming in comparison to relaxing on the roof. In fact, why was she even gung-ho to step in and help with somebody else's work? It just seems like wasting time she could spend relaxing. Why did she get bored of that again? Tracer spun on her heel and made her way back to the roof.

As soon as the elevator doors opened a loud hissing accompanied by thick purple smoke filled her lungs. Tracer coughed, gagging for air. The possibility of doing a Recall didn't occur to her until it was too late.

"Mmm. Mmm. Mnn."

Lena Oxton opened her eyes. The absence of her orange tinted visor tipped off that something was wrong. Well that and the unfamiliar surroundings. The atmosphere felt sinister and unfriendly unlike Overwatch HQ. The color scheme of this room is off-white like a hospital room. There is also a bed and a standing photo of a man beside the bed. Tracer’s vision is a little too blurred to make out who it is.

"Finally. My little Cherie is awake."

Tracer shook. The cold, whispery voice blew ice in her ear. Thin cold fingers wrapped around her jaw and forced her eyes on the captor. "Whe-where am I?" Her vision cleared enough to make out the figure standing over her. Purple skin reflecting the low internal temperature, long legs wrapped in a suit fitted for combat, and soulless yellow eyes piercing into Tracer’s brown eyes, "Amelie?!"

"You know that name means nothing to me. It’s Widowmaker."

Any attempt to strike Widowmaker or at least escape are denied by all four of her limbs being tied to the chair. Recalling would do nothing, but keep Tracer in the position she's been at. The situation currently reads as Lena Oxton is bound to a chair at the mercy of Widowmaker.

"Why did you take me here?” Tracer barked unable to disguise the panic in her tone, “Are we in T.A.L.O.N.?"

Widowmaker looked down at Tracer, her fingers still holding her jaw. The emotionless icy stare Widowmaker had sent shivers down Tracer’s spine, "Don't consider where you are T.A.L.O.N. headquarters, but rather my parlor, my dear."

"As soon as Overwatch knows I'm missing their going to bust down your door guns a blazing!"

"I'm not worried about that. All your communication devices are jammed by the interference signals. Calling your little friends would be a waste of effort."

"This is going to sound like a compliment. Ever since you joined Overwatch you’ve single handedly been the biggest pain in T.A.L.O.N.S. ass. Too many of our operations have gone off the rails because of your participation.” In a rare moment of actual humanity, Widowmaker furrowed her brow, just slightly, incidentally making her look less scary. “I’m especially talking about the day at the museum.”

Widow took her hand off Tracer’s chin and walked out of view, “So, I’m going to do all of T.A.L.O.N. of favor and get rid of you. However, simply killing you wouldn’t bring me joy, I’d rather see you suffer instead. By popping that Chronal Accelerator off of you. Seeing as I needed some kind of special device to remove it off of you"

"No! No! No! Please!" Tracer rattled in her seat. Trying to tilt it over, but Widowmaker held it in place. “I have a theory that if you become so large the damn thing will snap right off of you.” With that Widowmaker shoved something inside of Tracer’s mouth that started her experiment.

"I can't wait to find out!" She said with a blank face, “I’m practically giddy with excitement!”

What did Widowmaker put in Tracer's mouth?
114.title: Taken to the Widow's Parlor

choices: Tracer suddenly realizes there's a bit more to her "luv" then she remembered!
Emily's belly embarrassingly grumbles! Lena takes it as a sign for a lunch date
After helping clean up Tracer and Emily have a meal at home
115.content:
With everything relatively calm for the moment and despite being as outgoing and friendly as she was the brunette decided to leave everyone to their own devices and instead go out and spend the day with the woman she so dearly loved.

"Wonder what Em is up to?" The Brit wondered out loud as she pondered with a curious smile.

It was decided then she would go home to her beloved now that she actually had a chance to do so, and did just that after taking a moment to inform Winston where she was off to and to give her ring on the off chance that she was needed back at HQ...

Sometime later Tracer, Lena, was back home in King's Row, a place that had seen it's fair share of ups and downs...she had made a lot of memories here some good some bad but right now she didn't focus on that much like Overwatch HQ King's Row was much calmer on this day, people coming and going and generally simply living out their lives.

Lena smiled as she spotted several couples and families out and about it made her feel as if despite it all King's Row still continued to push forward made her feel as if she really was making a difference by being in Overwatch.

She chuckled to herself before deciding it was time to make her way home for a moment she thought over messaging Emily that she was on the way but instead decided to simply surprise her love...

Inside their shared apartment the redheaded Emily was busy with some home chores. She loved Lena Oxton with everything she had but it was days like these when the brunette was away that the redhead could some things done around the apartment.

Speaking of the hero Emily barely had time to register the door to her and Lena's apartment opening when she suddenly felt a pair of familiar arms latch on to her sides! She smiled however with a slight blush as she felt the warmth of the brunette's voice on her cheek.

"Hey luv, what cha doing?"
115.title: Take the day off and hang out with Emily

choices: Cut to dinner with the lovebirds.
Tracer wants to find some way to curb Emily's weight gain...
In an out-of-character moment, Tracer actually gets ravenous!
1151.content:
Emily couldn't help but grin ear-to-ear just from hearing her girlfriend's voice. She turned her head a little ways towards her to get a better look, hands still idly dusting off their coffee table.

"Well, I was cleaning up the mess somebody made on the way to work this morning, not naming any names..." The redhead pretended to sound annoyed. She turned properly to face Tracer and return the hug from earlier, with an extra-strong squeeze at the end. "Seriously though--mind leaving the marathon running till you're out of the apartment? You almost knocked over my mum's picture of us."

Lena winced slightly as she noticed said picture-frame much farther back from the edge of the table since she left this morning...Emily must've pushed it all the way back to avoid future incidents. She took two big steps over and slid it closer to it's original position, patting it gently on the picture.

"Sorry, sorry! I always feel like I'm later than I am, chronal disdainment and all that."

"Chronal disassociation, sweetie." Emily corrected, a slight smirk as she rested her hands on her hips.

"Yeah, that." Tracer frowned a bit and lifted her orange goggles off her face, taking a closer look at the old photo--not even old, it was only about six months old. Emily's mother had taken it on their third anniversary date, but something felt a little off between then and now...

She shot a quick and subtle glance at Emily, cherubic cheeked, thighs touching, warm-as-a-fireplace, and then looked back at the photo.

It took a few seconds for the penny to drop.

Aw, no, couldn't be...could it? Tracer thought, taking another good look at Emily.

She did look a little fuller around the edges, at a second glance. Her chin was definitely a little softer, with a more pronounced, sagging chest and the slightest hint of a potbelly...Lena was a little curious how her bum looked now too, but that was a question for later. The question for now was: did she really put on this much weight in just six months? Tracer used her generally scattershot memory to the best of her ability, thinking back to what had happened the last few months. Her promotion...Emily getting that job at the chocolatier shop...she had to work late on recon...Em talked about needing to order out more since Tracer hated eating leftovers, and cooking for one was no fun...

Connecting all the dots together, it did kind of make sense that Emily would start to get a bit plump. Lena felt a bit bad almost, like she had a hand in it all, such as the inverse of a pet owner neglecting to feed them. But at the same time, did she really notice it at all? Not once did she remember seeing a diet magazine lying around, or Emily talk about needing to hit the gy--

"Lena? Lena? I was asking if you wanted me to order a pizza tonight since I have you home early." Emily smiled once more, hands now resting a bit on the top of her potbelly, seemingly in anticipation of her future meal with her lover.

"Oh, er, yeah! Half n' half mushroom and pepperoni, like the usual?" She shook herself out of her Holmes-esque deduction on how her girlfriend packed on a few pounds to snap back to the present.

"Do you mind an order of breadsticks too? I doubt you'll have the room for it since you eat like a bird, but they have a coupon deal that expires today...and a get 2-for-1 on pizza, which I assume you also don't want. So, can I get a pepperoni all to myself?"

Tracer gulped, thinking of just how much Emily would put away by tonight's end.

"Heh, yeah, Em, go hog wild." She said, against her better judgment.
1151.title: Em and Tracy, sittin' in...an apartment...

choices: At times Emily found herself stress-eating over Tracer's well being
Lena never commented on her weight before so Emily kept at it
11511.content:
Okay so perhaps what she had earlier was...maybe not the best choice of words. There was enough of a meal on the dinner table to feed the roguish Roadhog but never her girlfriend! Or at least that's what Lena thought but after tipping the delivery driver and sitting down to eat the brunette was starting to find that to be the case.

Now granted her girl wasn't feasting like an animal, no in fact the pudgy redhead was rather refine in her eating ways taking care and cleaning up whenever applicable where Tracer was usually slightly more casual, not a slob by any stretch of the imagination but she remembered the few times Emily had told her to wipe her cheek or alternatively would do so for her which would cause Lena's face to flare up and match her love's hair color.

In any case she snapped out of her thoughts when she heard Emily call out to her to continue eating not to mention the redhead was getting a little worried Lena could be a little scatterbrained from time to time, not that she minded, but the only other times she could remember the heroine being this oddly silent and lost in thought was during her first mission as part of Overwatch and that one fateful day...Emily paused herself nibbling on her lower lip as she recalled the devastated despaired look on Lena's face when she dragged herself home that day...

If that woman had done something to Lena once more...the snapping of a bread stick with surprising strength caused her to break out of her own thoughts and lock eyes with her love as this time it was her turn to be asked what was a matter?

"Nothing, just lost in thoughts is all."

You and I both apparently, thought the heroine as she chuckled in near silent fashion an awkward smile on her lips.

"Truth be told, luv, and feel free to wack me upside the head with a bread stick for bringing it up but I noticed that..."

Emily sat silent watching her beloved try to spit out what she had on her mind but poor Lena simply couldn't bring herself to do it. She was this hero many looked up to and inspired to be she protected people loved people and yet she just couldn't ask her girlfriend about her weight!

'Why the bloody hell is it easier to face off against a ruthless terrorist like Reaper then it is to ask Em about her weight?!'

Tracer wondered the thoughts in her mind as much a blur as she normally was on the battlefield.

"I'm actually surprised it's taken this long for to ask, hun."

Huh? Come again.

"So that's what had you so caught up in your own thoughts. Oh thank goodness."

Tracer wondered for a moment what Emily had thought had occurred with her but ultimately moved on as it looked like she was finally going to get some answers.
11511.title: Cut to dinner with the lovebirds.

choices: The next day at Overwatch HQ, Tracer's got a big lunch
Tracer takes the month off for more quality time with Emily
In the bedroom...
1153.content:
"I'm cleaning up our little mess," replied Emily tickling Tracer's chin, "Help out, will ya? And no 'blinking' it causes too many accidents." Tracer giggled and kissed her girlfriend on the cheek, "Okay, Em."

"Seriously don't make me wrestle that chronal accelerator off of you."

The two got to work by splitting up duties. Tracer assigned herself to dusting shelves and sweeping crumbs from the kitchen floor while Emily took the task of cleaning the living room and preparing dinner. All throughout cleaning, Tracer fought the urge to zip from one room to the next, completely remaining obedient toward Emily’s wishes. The work, thankfully, managed to get done quicker than she imagined.

"Watch some TV while I finish up dinner," said Emily slipping off Tracer's shoes for her, "Can I at least see what it is? It smells good." Inquired Tracer, always the one being impatient, “No.”

Minutes had crawled by with each passing second having the urge to sneak into the kitchen grow stronger. The old reruns of Mr. Bean 4000 failed to keep her entertained, “You can only watch this so many times before it gets predictable.” Tracer’s restlessness started to act up. Her foot tapped on the carpet and her nails began to look biteable.

Emily, however, brought in dinner just in the nick of time. A pot of white golden melted cheese is set in front of Tracer, "Fondue? I love fondue." Emily tutted Tracer, "That's why it had to stay a surprise."

“Well, I certainly am surprised,” Along with the fondue a bowl of cooked chunks of meats and crusty bread down by the pot, "Oi, Em! You sure cooked a lot."

"I just wanted to make sure that we had more than enough to enjoy," responded Emily, “You must get so hungry running around all day. Now, c’mon, dig in.” The two began their meal. Tracer always known to be a real speed eater stabbed more than her girlfriend could get.

Emily, however, didn't mind. In fact she fed Tracer a large portion of her own meat and bread. Every bit was rewarded with a mewl of happiness and delight, rewarding Emily of a job well done. A few swiping motion had covered the last chunk of meat in the remaining melted cheese, "Open your mouth," instructed Emily who guided the stick towards Tracer's maw of meat, bread, and cheese.

"Aah. Ulp."

Tracer leaned back and rubbed her taut stomach, "Bloody hell, Em, that was down right tasty, but what's for dessert?" Tracer suggestively poked the redhead's arm. Emily flipped her hair with a giggle, "Hm. There is something I’ve been meaning to try on for you, but first I did get you a baker's dozen of donuts from the downtown bakery you like so much."

Geez, how much food did Emily get me?

"Oh, uh, okay! That's grea-"

"If you're a good girl and finish everything then I'll happily serve you the surprise second course,” Without hesitation, Tracer sat herself longways in Emily’s lap with her girlfriend dragging over the box of fresh donuts. Emily held on in her hand and had the other hand caress Tracer’s freckled cheek. The time jumper opened her mouth to have her girlfriend shove in bite after bite, "This is new, Em. I kinda like it."

"I knew you would." The two shared an open mouth kiss for a minute, Emily pulled away to hand another donut to Tracer.

Minutes later, the formerly filled box of donuts is nothing more now than a mess of crumbs. Tracer licked the remaining frosting from her lips, "That was amazing, Em! I-" Tracer huffed, the fullness finally hitting the pit of her stomach, "I may need some helping moving to the bedroom though."

The redhead chortled and offered the brunette a helping hand, "Oh, alright. C'mon, luv."
1153.title: Clean up and eat up

choices: Lena's put on some pounds but just how many
Lena's doughtier but noticing Emily come into the room she isn't the only one
11532.content:
At first Winston was slightly against his dearest friend taking a month off but since Overwatch as a whole had grown the mighty intelligent gorilla ultimately decided to honor his friend's request for some time off. Lena ecstatic gave her huge friend as solid a hug as she could muster before she was off to King's Row to happily spend the next month with the woman she loved.

And that she did as the days went by the two ladies enjoyed their time together. It had been a long time since Lena could simply sit back and enjoy Emily's company not to mention her fine cooking. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, the brunette was thankful to have a lover that could properly cook for the two of them of course that didn't mean that the pair didn't go out to eat either, the two going casual clothed for something more simple and to Lena's slight embarrassment more formal whenever a restaurant was their place of choice.

Tonight had been one of those times and as she removed the suit pants and jacket Lena was thankful to finally be free of those confining clothing, she had always been a more casual styled girl but for Emily she would dress up if she had to...plus there was the fact that her girl looked absolutely stunning in that short red dress of hers...

Lena exhaled doing her best to push the mental image of her gorgeous girlfriend aside and instead focused on unbuttoning her dress shirt which was being slightly stubborn for some reason.

"Bloody hell, this is why I never wear such rubbish as this."

The brunette complained to herself as she finally got the blasted shirt to cooperate, however what she saw afterwards surprised even her!

She has secretly wanted to her entire life
A new product is quite addictive. And fattening
Pharah, her lover, wants her to
Readers choice

123.content:
Mercy was in her Office within the New Overwatch Headquarters, as someone walked in silently and placed a package on Her Desk and they left as Mercy moved her hand towards the Package “What is this” she would say as she took of the Top of the Package, a note within it along with an assortment of chocolates and a small lunch, a sandwich and a drink.

As Mercy took the note and unfolded it, she way that it read “Dear Angela, I hope you enjoy these treats, Warning, they are quite addicting, You can probably find more though” and after reading that she stood up and picked up the package and moved to a table with a mirror next to it... design choices design choices... and she drank the Drink, it did taste quite good, and same with the sandwich, then she moved to the treats... “one by on... no I must have more, these are so good” her mind raced as quickly she turned from eating them one by one to stuffing her face with them and when they ran out, she stood up with one thing on her mind... More
123.title: A new product is quite addictive. And fattening

choices: No No No, this cannot be happening
She Loved Her Fat... maybe others could become fat with her...

13.content:
Overwatch. They are considered the world's hope for peace, whether they fended of attacks during the infamous Omnic Crisis, to hunting down members of the terrorist organization known only as "T.A.L.O.N". Their members come from various different backgrounds and ethnicities, ranging from the speedy lass from King's Row, Lena Oxton, codenamed: "Tracer". To the cybernetic ninja known as "Genji". To even old veterans from the original Overwatch team, such as the enigmatic "Soldier 76" to the Armor-clad "Reinhardt". Overall, Overwatch has welcomed numerous members from all walks of life. And there is no exception for one of Overwatch's youngest members, South Korean native, Hana Song. However, to the rest of the world, she is best known by her now iconic username: D.Va!

Before her rise to fame as a mech pilot, Hana Song went by her username "D.Va", representing her home country of South Korea in multiple international StarCraft gaming tournaments. At the youthful age of 16, she swiftly rose through the ranks, and became the top StarCraft player in the world, where she went undefeated for three consecutive years. But while D.Va gained notoriety in the world of gaming, the Omnic Crisis was very much active in South Korea. You see, twenty years ago, South Korea was attacked by a colossal Omnic monstrosity, which rose from the depths of the East China Sea, causing catastrophic damage to coastal cities before it was driven back beneath the waves, only to return every few years, similar to how Godzilla would often rise from the sea and attack Tokyo, Japan.

So, in response to such a destructive entity, the South Korean government developed a mechanized armored unit, known as the "Mobile Exo-Force of the Korean Army", or "M.E.K.A" for short, to combat the Omnic threat on South Korea and it's neighboring countries. However, with each encounter, the Omnic learned from it's battles with M.E.K.A, often reconfiguring itself with a different form, as well as appearing with new weapons and capabilities. As a result, each incident with this colossal Omnic ends with a stalemate, with the monstrosity being defeated...but not destroyed.

Unfortunately, as the Omnic continued to adapt, it was eventually able to disrupt M.E.K.A's drone-control networks, thus leaving South Korea vulnerable to attack, which left the military with only one viable option: To use pilots to control the mechs. Scrambling to find the most suitable candidates, the government turned to the country's least expected minority of people: South Korea's community of professional gamers, who happen to possess the necessary reflexes and instincts to operate the mechs and their advanced weapons systems. The top stars were drafted, including D.Va herself. Famous for her elite gaming skills, D.Va was known to be a fierce competitor who played to win at all costs, which earned her a well-earned reputation for showing absolutely no mercy to her opponents.

Despite seeing her new mission as a game, D.Va fearlessly charges into battle alongside her fellow M.E.K.A unit, ready to spring to her homeland's defense at a moment's notice. Though recently, she began to stream the combat operations she participates in to her adoring fans, and her growing following turning her into a global icon, which included having her starring in the Goldshire Pictures movie, "Hero Of My Storm".

This...is her story.

131.content:
--Downtown Busan, South Korea--
--Nighttime--

Busan, South Korea. Once a decent-sized city, Busan had exploded into a sprawling metropolis over the course of 20 long years. To the normal onlooker, it was your average sprawling metropolis. But to many people who have the Internet, this city was the home and Base of Operations for Overwatch member and M.E.K.A operative known throughout the world...as "D.Va".

But tonight, however...her life was going to change.

To elaborate, our story begins with D.Va participating in another mission from Overwatch, using her Mech to zip and bolt across the numerous rooftops of her home city of Busan. However, as she made her way across the Busan skyline, Winston, Overwatch's resident scientist and hyper-intelligent gorilla, was talking to her via earpiece communicator, where he spoke toward her and said, "Alright, D.Va. Here's what we know so far: The terrorist organization, T.A.L.O.N, has been moving 2 platoons of soldiers into Busan over the course of 72 hours. Judging from their communications, they appear to be searching either for something, or possibly someone, of great importance to them. Your mission is to discover what or who T.A.L.O.N is searching for, and retrieve the target before they do."

"Don't worry, Winston. I play to win!" D.Va quipped, her South Korean accent being noticeable as she spoke toward the hyper-intelligent ape with a sense of eager anticipation and enthusiasm, much to Winston's concern for the girl's fearlessness.

Eventually, D.Va had finally arrived at the designated location of her mission: The Busan Wharf. Viewing the area from a nearby rooftop, she could easily see approximately 3 squads of T.A.L.O.N soldiers, armed with assault rifles, entering inside the large warehouse single-file. However, just as she was about to rush headlong into the warehouse, she saw one of T.A.L.O.N's elite operatives, Reaper, enter the warehouse moments later. Obviously seeing the infamous Reaper as a great way to prove herself to Overwatch, as well as give her adoring fans some high-octane action, D.Va launched her Mech at high speeds, racing toward the warehouse, ready to give Reaper and T.A.L.O.N a bit of a nasty surprise.

Suddenly, she rammed into the warehouse wall, smashing through solid steel with ease, giving the T.A.L.O.N operatives a nasty surprise as she exclaimed, "Hello, boys! Let's play!" From there, she quickly began to open fire upon the T.A.L.O.N soldiers, firing off her Mech's Fusion Cannons in separate directions. However,in response to the ambush, Reaper began to fire his Dual Shotguns at D.Va's Mech , damaging it slightly. This left Reaper with little to no choice but to temporarily retreat until he could find an opening to take out D.Va without having to confront her Mech.

Once most to all of the T.A.L.O.N soldiers lied dead before her, D.Va eventually looked around the section of the warehouse she was in, where she then saw...

14.content:
No Emotion.

No Remorse.

No Conscience.

These human qualities had no place within the mindset of an assassin. And out of the numerous hired killers and military combatants on TALON's payroll, there was none other, no equal, than the cold-hearted and pale blue-skinned beauty that was now known only... as Widowmaker.

And yet, despite being the terrorist organization's most covert assassin and deadliest sniper, Widowmaker wasn't always TALON's prized but cold-hearted killer that she is known for today. In fact, for those who've dug deep enough... They would come face to face with a shocking but tragic truth.

Before she ever became one of TALON's most prized field agents, Widowmaker was once a beautiful and talented ballet dancer named Amélie LaCroix. Now, one must ask: Why would TALON want to transform this specific woman into who she is now?

...Well, the true reason for such an atrocity was not in Amélie and her raw talent for ballet. Instead, it was because she was avidly connected to someone of great interest but disdain to the terrorist organization. To elaborate, during the Golden Age of Overwatch, Amélie was happily married to a man named Gérard LaCroix. But in reality, Gérard LaCroix was actually an agent of Overwatch, who was spearheading the operations against TALON and their artwork operations. Of course, TALON retaliated numerous times by attempting to assassinate Gérard LaCroix. Time and time again, the terrorist organization failed repeatedly to kill him, whether it was from LaCroix's competency in combat, Overwatch's protection, or even TALON's ineffectiveness.

After this, TALON switched gears. Instead of going after Gérard directly, they went after someone who was very close to him.

And that someone... was his wife, Amélie LaCroix.

When they captured her, TALON operatives involuntarily subjected her to an intense yet painful program of neural reconditioning. After a single week, Amélie had become psychologically damaged. Her compassionate personality became suppressed. Her will...broken. And when they were finally done with her, Amélie had been reprogrammed as a TALON Sleeper Agent. Eventually, Overwatch managed to find and rescue Amélie, where they returned her to a normal life with her husband Gérard.

However, like any noteworthy tragedy, there was always someone getting killed.

And after two weeks had passed since she was rescued, Amélie killed Gérard in his sleep, then vanished without a trace. Initially, Overwatch seemed to have believed that Amélie had been kidnapped once more by TALON, but the truth...is far different from mere speculation. With her mission complete, she returned to TALON, where they completed the process of transforming the ballet dancer...into a living weapon. After extensive covert tactics and combat training, TALON subjected Amélie to some form of medical procedure. In turn, this altered her physiology and drastically slowed her heart rate, which turned her skin cold with a sickly blue pigment, along with numbing her ability to experience any form of human emotion.

By the time the process was complete, Amélie LaCroix had died that very moment. And in her place...was Widowmaker.
14.title: Step Into Her Parlor

choices: The kitchen. Most likely to get something cold & relaxing to drink.

141.content:
-- Paris, France --
- 8:29 PM -

Hamlet once said "To sleep, perchance to dream". But for the fractured and reconditioned mind of someone such as Amélie LaCroix, better known as "Widowmaker"...Sometimes dreaming mostly brings back haunting memories.

In her current attire, Amélie was currently wearing a green tanktop over a purple bra and panties, as she subconsciously tossed and turned underneath the covers of her bed, her body thrashing about lividly. But within her subconscious, she was experiencing something...haunting.

In her dream, she awoke in her old apartment with her husband, Gérard LaCroix, as she lovingly stroke her sleeping husband's black hair. She spoke sweetly toward his sleeping form as she said, "Gérard? Réveillez-vous. Vous avez du travail aujourd'hui (Gérard? Wake up. You have work today)."

She gently nudged him once or twice, but there was no response from him. In turn, Amélie became more concerned, turning over her husband as she worriedly asked, "...Gérard?" However, instead of seeing her sleeping husband, she only saw Gérard with his throat slit open.

In response, Amélie quickly leapt out of her bed in complete shock and horror, screaming at the top of her lungs as she shrieked, "Gérard !! NON!!! Non Non Non Non!!!! Cela ne peut pas être réel !!! (Gérard!! NO!!! No, no, no, NO!!!! This can't be real!!!)"

"Et pourtant ... C'est Amélie. (And yet... It is, Amélie.)" A voice coldly rang out, which unnerved the traumatised woman just a tad further, her eyes darting all over the room upon hearing the almost inhuman voice. From there, Amélie then heard the sharp clacking of metal heels against the hardwood floor, which only got louder as the noise got closer to her, only to reveal a woman in a slick lavender one-piece leotard with futuristic fishnet leggings, whose skin was a cold blue hue, whilst wearing a visor over her face, which seemed akin to a spider's many eyes.

"POURQUOI!?! Pourquoi as-tu fait cela?! (WHY!?! Why did you do this?!)" Amélie shrieked, screaming at her husband's murderer, who still retained such a stone cold expression on her lithe form. But then, the blue-skinned assassin then cokkd spoke and answered, "Parce que je suis toi. et toi... (Because... I am you. And you...)"

But as the assassin spoke, the woman casually tore off the spider-like visor from her head and face, revealing something horrific to Amélie: The blue-skinned femme fatale before her was...actually herself. The blue-skinned Amélie then glared back at her frightened counterpart, staring at her with a set of piercing yet heartless golden yellow eyes as she continued, "... c'est moi. (...Are me.)"

Suddenly, before Amélie could even utter a single word, her blue-skinned counterpart swiftly wrapped her fingers around Amélie's throat with almost inhuman speed, beginning to strangle her, as the blue-skinned Amélie's voice became more distorted and inhuman as Amélie felt her life slipping through each desperate breath, coldly speaking toward Amélie with contempt and malice as she said, "Je suis le veuf Et vous ... êtes entré dans mon salon. (I am the Widowmaker. And you...have stepped into my parlor.)"

In her last gasp of air, Amélie unleashed a most harrowing of screams, as if futilely lashing out a final desperate act of rebellion.

However, back in the real world, this caused Widowmaker to suddenly jolt up from her bed, her eyes wide and full of a familiar yet thought long abandoned feeling: Fear. Her golden yellow eyes darted from left to right, as she attempted to slow down her heartbeat, inhaling and exhaling several deep breaths in the process.

"...Merde. Ce même rêve maudit encore. (...Fuck. That same damned dream again.)" Widowmaker muttered under her own breath, where she then violently unfurled the bedsheets from her lithe form, standing up from the bed as she did so. She stretched her arms from left to right, making sure she was properly flexible, obviously out of habit considering her current line of work these days.

From there, Widowmaker then casually walked her way over toward...
141.title: Haunted By The Past

1411.content:
From there, Widowmaker then casually walked her over toward the kitchen, most likely to get something cold and refreshing to drink in order to calm her nerves. She opened the refrigerator door, carefully examining the edible contents within the fridge, where she then spot one of those D.Va-sponsored Nano-Cola canisters.

Not feeling the mood for some champagne, Widowmaker reluctantly grabbed the Nano-Cola can, popped it open, which caused it to blur out a brief auditory advertisement. Suffice to say, it mildly annoyed the hardened femme fatale. And yet, as she calmly reclined against a nearby sofa, Widowmaker couldn't help but feel a twinge of envy towards the 19 year old South Korean pilot of MEKA, especially when D.Va still had a semblance of youthful optimism and playful demeanor, despite the smack talk.

"Ça doit être agréable de ne pas s'inquiéter de ce que tes supérieurs soient si ... épuisants. Dommage que tu sois encore si jeune, D.Va. (...Must be nice not to worry about your superiors being so...strenuous. A shame you are still so young, D.Va.)" Widowmaker muttered to herself, contemplating on how contrasting D.Va's current state of life was compared to her own, what things might have been if she wasn't kidnapped and brainwashed by TALON, taking another sip from the Nano-Cola canister in the process.

However, just as she was about to take another sip, something fell from the bottom of the canister, dropping onto Widowmaker's lap. Of course, the cold-hearted assassin soon took notice of this, as she calmly picked up the object with her free hand as she queried, "...Que se passe-t-il? (...What the hell?)"

From there, shortly after placing the Nano-Cola upon the nearby coffee table, Widowmaker then proceeded to examine the object before her, which appeared to be a folded up sheet of paper, which puzzled the femme fatale, especially since everything was mostly digital these days.

Obviously, curiosity got the better of her, as Widowmaker soon unfolded the sheet of paper, which inevitably was revealed to be a written letter specifically for her. From there, Widowmaker soon began to read what was written on the letter, which read:

"Widowmaker,

Or...should I say, Amélie,

I'm not sure if you will receive this letter. But if you do, I want to help you. I know what T.A.L.O.N did to you thanks to Winston and Tracer. Normally, M.E.K.A doesn't deal with terrorist organizations unless the Omnics happen to be involved, but I pulled a few strings to allow me and several others to help you.

You can refuse if you want to. However, if you do want our help to free you from T.A.L.O.N, meet me over at M.E.K.A Headquarters in Busan. I know some people who can help you.

Good Luck!

-D.Va"

Nonetheless, Widowmaker was honestly wasn't expecting something like this coming from someone like D.Va, who she had very little to absolutely no connections with aside from attending a few ops together across different parts of the world, especially if M.E.K.A and T.A.L.O.N's goals happen to align with one another, which so happened to be a rare occasion considering T.A.L.O.N was a notorious terrorist organization wanted in numerous countries.

But still... Why would D.Va go out of her way just to let her know that she wants to help her? Widowmaker thought to herself, clearly confused as to what D.Va's motives were. And yet, in the dark recesses of her mostly indoctrinated subconscious, the remnants of what little remained of Amélie LaCroix began to crawl it's way back into the forefront of Widowmaker's thoughts, becoming akin to the femme fatale's own Jiminy Cricket, speaking to her as the voice said, "... Vous devriez accepter son offre. (...You should accept her offer.)"

"Que savez-vous, Amélie? (What would you know, Amélie?)" Widowmaker scolded, her voice seething with distrust toward what little remained of who she used to be. Of course, that only embolden this newfound yet unwanted conscience within Widowmaker's mind, as it then retorted, "... Pensez-y, Widowmaker: Que se passera-t-il si T.A.L.O.N vous considère obsolète? Hm? (...Think about it, Widowmaker: What will happen if T.A.L.O.N considers you obsolète? Hm?)"

The thought never crossed Widowmaker's mind until the voice of Amélie brought that up. Suffice to say, it certainly unnerved the cold-hearted assassin somewhat. Then again, she wouldn't put it past them, considering their history of terminating defective operatives should they become compromised.

Eventually, after much contemplation and consideration, Widowmaker inevitably decided to...

151.content:
(Edited by: Writerstrike Original chapter written by Johan27)

Pharah felt the wind whipping through her hair as she whizzed high above the training ground. One target popped out from cover to be greeted with a rocket to the face. Every few hundred feet a new target hopped out only to be blown to pieces by a expertly aimed rocket.

A crew of training bots scattered and secured the payload. Grinning widely, Pharah knew what time it is, “Allow me to tell you the forecast.” The blue Raptora armor hovered around the payload and opened its many cavities to reveal the robots doom, “JUSTICE RAINS FROM ABOVE!” The robots screamed and attempted to scatter, but all were caught in the blast radius and subsequently destroyed, “Targets down.” Pharah descended to the ground and nodded to herself for a job well done, “That’s all for today, boys.”

The robots reassembled themselves and went back to their resting pods. In the distance, Captain Ana Amari watched with a worried look in her eye.

Returning to base, Pharah couldn't let go of the exhilarating feeling; being with Overwatch and protecting the innocent. Pharah took off her helmet and enjoyed the breeze of the night wind, from behind her mother offered her a tired smile and a hug, "Allow me to tell you the forecast, huh?” Pharah rubbed the back of her head, “I needed a cool opener to my catchphrase.” Ana shook her head, “You did a fantastic job out there. Just don't lose yourself to this life, as I did, child." Pharah shook her head, “Do not worry, mother. Let’s focus on creating peace and harmony between human and omnic.” She stated making her way towards Overwatch HQ.

Ana sighed heavily at the sight. She wasn't going to lose her daughter, not to the joys of battle or a sense of misplaced martyrdom. To make that so, she made her exit, to Angela Ziegler's office.

“Big dinner tonight, huh?” Tracer questioned, picking at her pasta. She eyed the massive feast Pharah brought to the table. Toppling with cheeseburgers, fried chicken, a few vegetables, and a little desert of a few slices of cake, “Not to be rude, but I think you got as much as Zarya usually gets!” Pharah chuckled, “That’s has to be impossible.” Pharah grabbed a cheeseburger and took a massive bite from it.

“Using the Raptora suit take a lot of energy, y’know.” Pharah said sinking her teeth into a fried chicken leg, “I didn’t take it easy at the training grounds either.” Few minutes had passed for Pharah to finish her entire meal, she licked her fingers clean of what food remained. Her mouth still watered from what she tasted. As much as people always talked down militant food courts the rations at Overwatch HQ is always hailed as top notch.

“Woah, you finished that quick, Pharah!” said Tracer, being one to be easily impressed, “No doubt. I’ll be seeing you around, Tracer.”

When Pharah exited the mess hall, her wrist watch blipped to the sound of a notification. An email displayed in the form of an holographic projection:

To Fareeha (Pharah), From Symmetra
I request your assistance with a creation of mine. Report to my quarters when you have the time.

Pharah cringed at the thought, Symmetra isn’t the most ideal member of the Overwatch roster to work with, often off offhandedly cold and aloof giving heavy air of pretentiousness in her voice, but it is a pretty special honor to be specifically requested by her, “…I guess.”

On the other hand, Pharah is still feeling peckish after her large dinner. Nothing is worse than going to bed feeling hungry, so getting more food is an option and a pretty good excuse to get out of helping Sym.

What should Pharah do?

15111.content:
Ana sees that her daughter's figure did not change at all from last night. She still had the physique of a combat hardened soldier.Rock-hard abs, Toned Legs, Sculpted Arms, and any fat that she did have was minimal and did not impede her movement at all. Ana knew that the effects would not take place that quickly as Pharah did not have any extra calories that could stored as blubber, yet. Pharah then disappeared into the cafeteria waiting line which was empty due to it being so early in the morning. Pharah then grabbed her usual breakfast consiting of sunny-side up eggs, toast and a few pieces of bacon after which she took a seat next to her mother. Ana greeted her daughter with a smile and said "Good morning, Fareeha." Pharah replied with a similar response. A fee moments of awkawrd silence passed as Pharah began to dig into her meal. Ana excused herself, saying that she had to use the restroom; when in fact her had returned to her quarters to spy on her daughter via hidden cameras she had set up beforehand to spy on her daughter and to assure that her presence did not affect her daughter's eating. By the time she had started to watch the camera feed she had noticed that Pharah had already eaten a large portion of her food, which was unsual as she normal eats her food at a slower pace, Ana grinned as she knew the nano bots had began to take effect.

/Pharah's POV/

As she began to dig into her food her mother had stood up from the table that they were sitting at and said "Excuse me Fareeha, I need to go to the restroom." She simply nodded as her had a mouthful of toast and was unable to reply. Pharah wolfed down the toast and bacon and began digging into the eggs; as she was eating she thought about why she was so hungry today. She woke up 30 minutes ahead of her usual schedule because her stomach rumbled her awake, she reasoned that it was because she had a very intense battle the day before and her body was just recovering the energy it had spent during the fight. Snapping back to reality she realized she had eaten all of her food, but still her tummy urged her to get more, which she obliged. Getting 3 chocolate glazed doughnuts instead. Pharah gobbled down the first two and began to finally have the feeling of fullness set on, she ate the last pastry a bit slower but finished it all the same. 152.content:
Work work work. It felt like all she did nowadays was work.

Mei sat up straight from her computer, moaning as she stretched out the tightness in her back. Reaching past Snowball lying asleep on her desk, she grabbed her thermos and took a long drink, looking out at the rain dripping down the window at Overwatch HQ. Things had been uncharacteristically quiet around here, and a decade or so ago she would have relished the chance to stay inside and do her research. Now that she was an Overwatch agent and had a taste of action, so to say, it was harder for her to stay still and keep busy doing the same thing over and over again. Not while there was more she could do then ever before. Sometimes she envied the villains like Junkrat who never had to worry about this sort of drudgery.

The Chinese climatologist sighed to herself. Maybe she just needed a little bit of a break to clear her head. Then she could get on track and really continue her research. The planet depended on it after all. Putting aside the mountains of data readouts, Mei opened up her e-mail server first and two messages popped up. Recognizing the Chinese lettering in the first one, Mei opened it up.

Mei-Mei,

I'm being sent on a really dull public relations tour to Spain next month, if you're still in Gibraltar do you want to meet up for dinner sometime? Been really missing you, lemme know if you can make it work!

Hui-fang Hu

Mei smiled, immediately typing a response accepting the dinner invitation. Mei had spent a lot of time tracking down her old friends and family after she was unfrozen, and Hui had been someone she was especially glad was still around. You wouldn't think a ditzy popular girl would want anything to do with a chubby geek working on her second degree and vice versa, but the two had really got along together, becoming the kind of inseparable friends that got confused for family at every party and event they went to. And to think it all started with a trade; Mei would help Hui with her studies and teach her some good educational habits, and in turn Hui would help her with a diet sabotaged by the stresses of high education and help to keep her weight down. Idly, Mei poked at her belly and wondered; what would life had been like if she didn't ever meet Hui-fang and get her diet under control?

Putting that thought out of mind, Mei turned to the other email, this one far more official and less meaningful then the one from her friend. It turned out it was another invitation; Volskaya Industries was hosting a seminar on the climate sciences, and they invited her to be a keynote speaker! Mei was surprised and grateful for such an opportunity, though she couldn't help but wonder why Volskaya of all companies was hosting this event, since they were usually the ones burying this sort of research. Whatever the circumstances, maybe this could be a great opportunity to mingle with other scientific minds in her field. And hey, maybe that cute weightlifter would be there too.

No longer bored, and with at least two trains of thought, Mei decided to...

153.content:
Four walls of pure white. Not a single atom is different in color. All uniform in all perfect dimensions. This pleased Symmetra to no end.

She sat alone in her room, as she did every day for hours on end. The architect spent that time roaming around in her own mind. Thinking of the many ways to make the world a better place. Not a soul dared to bother her for they were specially instructed that the consequences would be severe.

Her position at Overwatch HQ served as a abroad program so to speak. The higher ups at Vishkar believed that traveling to America would give Symmetra a fresh perspective on the world. So far, she been utterly disappointed. Especially with her open disliking of the members of Overwatch

Deep in her own mind she took a walk through a garden. One created from beautiful light. Giving plants the energy to grow and blossom into eye-pleasing floral attractions. Other plants grew to produce fruits and vegetables.

GRUUUMBLE

All the time she spent thinking and kept herself sheltered from the others, Symmetra hadn't thought about lunch. That was it. A pang of hunger. Hunger! That is something the world struggles with! Food has always picked at Symmetra's curiosity for sustainability. One minute you have it, then BAM it's gone in a second, "If light can give plants the energy to produce vegetables and substance for insects then perhaps, I can manipulate the energy from light to create a substance and cut out the middleman. No eating or plant growing necessary."

Symmetra didn't need things such as drafting board, pencils, or paper, all that she needed was her imaginative mind and the mechanical prosthetic that allowed her to bring her brain to life.
She whirled her arms in a fantastical fashion letting the energy flow with her to direct to her fingertips. Just when everything aligned,Symmetra brought her hands forth and-

"HOORAY!"

A distraction! Damnit! Symmetra grumbled, the sudden derailing of thought always pissed her off more than anything. The energy within her distorted back into wherever it came from.

A wave of her mechanical arm created a monitor linked to the cameras outside of her room. One camera gave her a view of the nearby break room. “It looks like someone is celebrating their birthday,” Sym mumbled eyeing the sliced cake on the table, "Great! There should be enough for everyone...who wants to bring Symmetra a piece?" Jack Morrison said.

Everyone looked away, a few rubbed the back of their heads. McCree was the only one to speak up, "Oh, she probably doesn't like cake anyhow."

Symmetra shut everything off. For a while, she sat herself in the lonely light room and tapped her foot. She wasn’t angry about missing out on cake, but rather angry at herself, the way she...went about things.

"Perhaps I should just focus on my creations," on the computer she kept in the corner an email notification from Mei popped up asking for help, "Or maybe start small."

Symmetra goes about...

info.brief_description: A weight gain focused interactive of the ladies from the Overwatch universe.
info.description:
RULES

Sorry, but before posting in this interactive I have to lay down a few laws for any additions made here.

1. Female gains only. I'm sure there is a way you can make a male focused Overwatch story if you want, but here female weight gain only. However, males are allowed to encourage the weight gain and feed the women.

2. No toilet stuff. Period Peeing/Pooping/Gas (Except belching is A-OK) allowed in this interactive.

3. Other types of expansion (blueberry, inflation, water inflation, GTS, etc) are allowed, but cannot be the main focus. If it has to come to that then just write your own story.

4. Any weight gain involving magic isn't allowed within reason. If it takes place within a fictional landscape further than Overwatch (i.e. Junkenstein's Revenge) then its okay. Alternatively, weight gain involving ray guns are allowed. This does take place in the future with freeze guns and healing staffs.

5. No one under the age of 18 is allowed to gain weight. However under 18 is allowed to feed.

6. Quality. I'm sure you all are very capable writers and enjoy doing what you do. It's the reason why you're here. That said, I would like for the characters to be in character (i.e. Tracer and Widowmaker cannot be depicted as friends), motives for gaining weight or causing weight gain to somewhat make sense (i.e. Ana fattens Pharah to keep her out of duty), and please keep chapters above a 600 word count.

7. Have fun with what you're doing and enjoy yourselves.
